loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, together with her mother and sister, is involved in clothing sales. From their house, they sell a large variety of clothing to their customers (mostly local people in the town). Mariam also organizes sales in nearby villages, where people have an opportunity to pay for clothing they buy with agricultural products. People in the villages usually don't have cash in hand, so it is very convenient for them to purchase clothing from Mariam and pay for it in the form of food products.

To be able to request new winter clothing supplies for their customers, Mariam has applied for this loan. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for winter clothing supplies.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver is from Sisian town. He is married with two children. His elder daughter is eight-years-old and the younger one is six-years-old.

Nver provides a transportation service from Sisian town to Yerevan using his own car.

To be able to continue his work during the winter, Nver needs to improve his car's working conditions. He has applied for this loan to purchase four tires and pay for the gas installation.

His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for four tires and gas installation

loans.name: Mirna Liceth

texts.es: Mirna de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 20 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Mirna está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mirna, age 46, lives in her own home with her husband and daughter.  She has worked sewing clothing for twenty years.  Her workshop is located in her place of residence.  She has many customers due to the quality with which she makes the clothes.  

Mirna is asking for a loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.  In this way she can continue with her work, which gives her good earnings.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca, aged 46 years, has a veterinary drug shop as her main source of income. She also earns a monthly salary of UGX 400,000. She is married and has six children, one of whom attends school at the moment.

She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 (Two million, five-hundred thousand shillings only). She will use the loan to buy a stock of veterinary drugs to sell at her business.

She is a hardworking person, who works eight hours a day and six days a week. She started business in the year 2003, in a rural setting. She has seen it grow from one level to another, through her hard work. The business is carried out from Kyabugimbi, Bushenyi District, and her customers are farmers. The farmers' continued support and her tireless efforts have helped her to grow. She started this very business, to be able to have a source of income to cater for her family's needs. Her major challenge in the business is competition from other farmers, but she is ready to grow through her hard work. She hopes to be financially stable, and educate her child who is still schooling.

loans.use: to buy veterinary drugs.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey, who is 41 years old, is an agriculturalist, mainly in tea growing. He is married with four children ages 14, 12, 10 and 8 years, all in school at the moment. 

He started farming in 2008 from Kayanga, Bushenyi district. He trades in goats as his additional source of income to support his family. 

He has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy fertilizer for his business. He is a hardworking man who works 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. His clients are tea factories and traders. Their continued support and his tireless efforts have enabled him to grow. 

He faces the challenge of poor weather, but has learned to manage it through his hard work. He hopes is to be financially stable and educate all his children for the better future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
María Guadalupe is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:

María is 64 years old; she is married and the mother of five. 

She makes a living by selling candy in different markets not far from her house. She rotates the location in order to have more clients; she has been in this business for 25 years now.
 
Specifically, she offers her clients chocolates, cookies, sweets and fritters. She asks for this loan to stock up her business with merchandise, especially because the holiday season is coming up, and markets are usually full of people who can be her potential customers. 

With the effort Maria puts into her work, she has been able to help her husband with the restyling of their house, which they are carrying out, and to buy a van used in the business.

loans.use: to stock up her candy sellling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, lavatory, mirror, hairdryer and flat iron

loans.name: Babula

texts.en:
Babula is 45 years old, and is a differently abled man who works and lives in the small village of Angul district of Odisha, India. He lives with his wife and two children. His children are in school. 

Babula owns a very small grocery store with a very limited product range. He can provide a better option to his village's customers if he can add more items in his grocery store. Currently he earns 2,000 India rupees (INR) per month from this business, which is very low for his monthly household expenses. 

Babula has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase sugar, edible oil, biscuits, chocolates, and spices in bulk to increase his sales. He has a dream to send his children to a good school. He is grateful to Kiva, Kiva lenders, and Peoples Forum for this support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, edible oil, biscuits, chocolates, and spices in bulk to increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar, as well as to pay for the labor for building a perimeter wall on her home.

loans.name: La'azaru

texts.en: La'azaru is a maize farmer from Bazana I village, in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, La'azaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, La'azaru can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. La'azaru, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia lives with her elderly retired mother in Stepanavan town. She works at local library and also sells clothing from her house. Sofia works hard to sustain their living and cover daily costs. 

Sofia has applied for this loan to purchase new stock of winter clothing and acquire perfumes. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing and perfumes for reselling

loans.name: Waldo Walter

texts.es:
Waldo es un hombre de 25 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de edredones.
Él es emprendedor, constante, independiente, activo, constante y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘Pampahasi’ un área comercial residencial, se caracteriza por las calles y avenidas pronunciadamente paradas porque se encuentra en una ladera, de clima frio y seco.
Waldo es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza en casa de su madre quién es su única familia, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo que cuenta con electricidad y agua potable. Su negocio es el comercio de edredones y ropa de cama, como sábanas, fundas de almohadas, cubrecamas, frazadas, etc. labor que realiza de forma ambulante todos los días de la semana en diferentes ferias y mercados; “comencé con un capital mínimo para un juego de sabanas y edredones, actualmente compro por mayor y mi negocio se está estabilizando”. Su sueño es tener una casa, y desea realizar la compra de edredones por mayor para surtir su negocio y ofertar mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Waldo solicita un préstamo para la compra de edredones por mayor para surtir su negocio y ofertar mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Waldo, who is 25 years old, is a single man with no children and he has a business selling quilts. He is enterprising, steady, independent, active and hard-working. He does his business in the 'Pampahasi' area, which is a commercial/residential area which is known for its very steep streets and avenues, since it is located on a hillside, and has cold and dry climate.

Waldo has a dark complexion, is of short stature and has short black hair. His mother tongue is Aymara and he speaks Spanish for business. He lives in a house with his mother, who is his only family. They live in a house built of brick which has electricity and drinking water. His business is selling quilts and bedlinen such as sheets, pillowcases, bedcovers and blankets etc. He works as a street vendor every day of the week in various fairs and markets. "I started with a minimum of capital for a set of sheets and quilts and now I buy wholesale and my business is becoming established". 

His dream is to have a house, and he wants to buy quilts wholesale in order to stock his business and offer his customers a better variety of products. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years he has been running this business. This is why Waldo is asking for a loan to buy quilts wholesale to stock his business and offer a wider range of products.

loans.use: to buy quilts wholesale to stock his business and offer a wider range of products.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Adamu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, andhe hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to reduce pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, trays of eggs, cans of margarine, cans of chocolate powder, cans of condensed milk

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Usman would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Usman is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara lives with her 6-year-old son. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. 

Nara sells clothing for kids from her house. She works hard to sustain her family's living and cover daily costs. 

To purchase new stocks of winter clothing for children Nara has applied for this loan.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Please help this hardworking woman to gather more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for winter stocks of clothing for kids

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.ru:
Зарифа жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина 36 лет.  Она замужем. У Зарифы пока еще нет детей. Зарифа не имеет высшего образования, так как в свое время у ее семьи не было возможности оплатить ее учебу в высшем заведении. Ее муж тоже не имеет высшего образования. Они живут в городе.
Зарифа хочет приобрести новую мебель. Зарифа обратились в нашу организация за кредитом для покупки мебели. Зарифа надеется на положительный результат своей просьбы и благодарит Арванд за поддержу.
texts.en: Zarifa is a happy and hardworking 36-year-old woman. She is married. Zarifa does not yet have children. Zarifa does not have a higher education because at that time her family did not have an ability to pay for her university education. Her husband also does not have a higher education. They live in the city. Zarifa wants to purchase new furniture. She requested a loan from our organization to buy furniture. Zarifa hopes for a positive outcome of her request and thanks Arvand for the support.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture

loans.name: Yusuf Madakin-Daji

texts.en: Yusuf Madakin-Daji is a maize farmer from Furana village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf Madakin-Daji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf Madakin-Daji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yusuf Madakin-Daji, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru:
Рузибой  очень трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 58 лет. У Рузибоя среднее техническое образование. Дети Рузибоя уже взрослые и живут  отдельно. Жена Рузибоя домохозяйка. Смотрит за огромным хозяйством. 
У Рузибоя имеется крупно рогатый скот. Он ухаживает за ним. Жена так же помогает Рузибою. Она продает соседям  молоко, полученным от скота. От данного дела Рузибой имеет хороший доход. Сейчас Рузибой хочет получить кредит, чтобы увеличить численность скота. Рузибой заранее благодари Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Ruziboy is a very hardworking 59-year-old man. Ruziboy has a secondary technical education. Ruziboy's children are already grown and live separately. His wife is a homemaker, who looks after a huge household. Ruziboy has cattle. He takes care of it, and his wife also helps him. She sells milk, obtained from cows, to their neighbors. Ruziboy has a good income from this business. Ruziboy currently wants to obtain a loan to increase his livestock headcount. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
DUTERIMBERE is a group led by Grace, who is 54 years old. The group name means “vision” in English. Grace has been a group leader for 6 years. She sells food stuffs and has been in this business for 6 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. 

With the loan, Grace would like to buy more beans and maize for resale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Mirian Aracely

texts.es: Miriam de 40 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam is forty years old and lives in her own house with her family. She owns a small store set up in her home. She has a large customer base, thanks to her good prices and her kind service. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. so that she can make a better income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Gaje

texts.en: Gaje is a maize farmer from Barangwaje village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Gaje would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Gaje can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Gaje, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Isidora

texts.es: Maria de 57 años de edad se dedica a la venta de juegos de comedor y mesas de madera desde hace varios años, ya tiene clientes establecidos por la calidad de sus productos, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para tener mejores ganancias y asi una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en: Maria is 57 years old and has been selling dining room sets and wooden tables for the last few years. She already has established clients thanks to the quality of her products. Maria lives with her husband and is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise and thus have better earnings and a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: Buy dining room sets and wooden tables for wholesale.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit and her daughter have been involved in selling confectioneries in the central market of Vanadzor town. For 10 years they have worked hard to run their business sustainably. 

To be able to purchase furniture for the new store and confectionery products for selling in the store, the loan is very important for the business development. Anahit would greatly like to receive this support from lenders

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for furniture for her new store and candies for selling.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer from the village of Furana in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Sani, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest-time.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Abubakar expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gaulua

texts.en: Gaulua is a 50-year-old divorced woman with two children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Gaulua needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Gaulua has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler and soft drinks.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 27 year old divorced woman with 3 children.

Nora runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 6 years of experience with this business.

Nora needs a loan to buy drinks, a boiler, foam cups, sugar, bread, butter, flour, cooking oil and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

Nora has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy drinks, a boiler, foam cups, sugar, bread, butter, flour, cooking oil and paper plates

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en: Luafulu is 44 years old and single with one child. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Luafulu needs a loan to buy gloves, a pitch-fork, chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, pots and seeds. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Luafulu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy gloves, a pitchfork, chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, pots and seeds.

loans.name: Flor De Azucena Atitlan Group

texts.en:
Santiago Atitlán sits in a valley nestled between two volcanoes on Lake Atitlán. The town is known for its historical and cultural importance. In this picturesque municipality, ten women come together as part of the Flor de Azucena Atitlán, or Atitlán Flower Trust Bank. The group is made up of passionate, exuberant businesswomen who take pride in their Kakchiquel Mayan traditions while making use of modern conveniences to run their businesses and improve their lives.

Andrea is one of the members of the Trust Bank. Andrea and her husband, a mechanic in Santiago, have six children. As a child, this hardworking individual attended school for six years, but was forced to abandon her studies due to a lack of resources. Andrea now owns a hardware store, which she has operated for five years. Thanks in part to the income of her business, all of six her children have attended school up to university level and one is currently a teacher. As she currently doesn´t have any employees, she operates the store by herself. However, with the new loan she plans to hire an employee to help her with merchandise and customer service. So, Andrea is applying for a loan. She also plans to diversify the tools and products she carries in her store. 

During their monthly meetings, the women receive informal education on diverse topics such as health and wellness, business management and strategies to improve their sales in order to improve their self-esteem and run their businesses effectively. This month, before receiving their new disbursement of Kiva loans, the women discuss the details of the loan. They all agree to pay on time and to support each other in their business ventures. 

The members of the Atitlán Flower Trust Bank are thankful for the generosity of Kiva investors. With the help of people worldwide, the women are able to work towards a brighter future for themselves, their families and the community of Santiago Atitlán.

loans.use: To hire an employee to assist in the business and diversify inventory.

loans.name: Giovanny Alfredo

texts.es: Giovanny de 34 años de edad posee un negocio de venta de pupusas ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada desde hace 7 años, su esposa es quien le ayuda con el negocio, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, harina de arroz, etc. para continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos ya que en estos ultimos meses le ha ido muy bien con las ventas.
texts.en:
Giovanny is 34 years old. He has been working selling pupusas for seven years. His business is located near his home, in a very busy area. His wife helps him run the business. They live together with their two children in the home they own.

He is requesting a new loan to buy more corn, pork rinds, cheese, beans, rice flour, etc. so that he can keep his business going. It generates a good income for him, and the past few months have shown very good sales.

loans.use: to buy more corn, pork rinds, cheese, beans, rice flour, etc.

loans.name: Adjorman Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four people who are part of the Adjorman Group and are very ready to develop their money-earning businesses. For several years, they've all been living in the same area and they maintain good relationships. Their main business is selling kenkey (cooked corn paste), towels, secondhand clothing, sewing accessories, car carpets, cooked food, and cosmetics. 

Francisca is the featured borrower of the group. She's the woman standing on the right in the photograph. She's a very focused single woman who has one dependent child in her care. She buys secondhand clothing and towels, and she intends to sell them to her neighbors. She will also buy corn dough to prepare kenkey and sell it to her customers. She has a very large base of clients and would want to satisfy her clients successfully. 

With her new loan, she intends to buy GHS 1,500 worth of one bale of secondhand clothing to sell to her customers. She intends to use her profits to improve the standard of living of her family and ensure that her child gets a better education. The group will need a total amount of GHS 4,200 to maintain their businesses at this level.

loans.use: To buy one bale of secondhand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Samaila is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest thereby allowing him to buy food and clothing with his increased income

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a first-time borrower of the institution, applying for 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings. 

Allan is a married man of three children whom he takes care of with the help of his wife. Allan drives a motorcycle to earn income to support his young family. His family, however, lives in miserable conditions because he lives in a slum that floods when it rains. Using his meager earnings from the motorcycle taxi, he was able to buy a plot of land and start building. Allan needs money so bad so that he can complete the construction and raise his children in a habitable environment. 

He is hardworking and resilient and thanks the Kiva lenders for the commendable job they are doing for the people living in poverty. He sees his future and that of his children being better in the near future.  

Allan’s future hope is having his children complete their university studies so that they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon owns a few cows and sheep and lives on his small farm with his family. 

He decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to reduce his operating costs by taking advantage of his animals' manure. By inputting their waste in the biodigester, the natural methanisation process and bacteria produce (1) biogas, which is directly connected to the kitchen and bathroom, and (2) an organic, nutrient-rich fertilizer. 

Simon will become more self-sufficient, as he will save money by displacing the expensive LP gas and improve the yield of his crops in a natural way, while also protecting the environment. The piles of waste will not contaminate watersheds anymore.  His farm will become a cleaner and more comfortable place to live. 

With his savings, Simon would like to buy more animals to expand his farm.

This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bitrus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Kezia, Wisdom and Christopher.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Bitrus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest thereby allowing him to pay for school fees and uniforms with his increased income

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Maryamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Hassan, Serah and Gambo.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Maryamu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest thereby allowing her to pay for school fees and uniforms with her increased income

loans.name: Erika Aracely

texts.en: Erika repaid her first loan on time and now is asking for a second loan to restock her grocery store for the end-of-year season. She wants to buy more grocery products, such as sodas and other items which have a high rotation. Erika's goal is to keep growing her business and to save so she can continue making improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products, such as sodas and items which have a high rotation for her grocery store.

loans.name: Abril Aranxa

texts.en:
Abril Aranxa is 19 years old and lives in her grandparents' house. She is studying marketing and supports herself by selling men's and women's clothes. She has repeat clients who recommend her and make referrals. 

Abril Aranxa s requesting a loan to buy men's and women's clothes so she can offer a wider product variety because this is the season when the sales are better. Her biggest accomplishment is paying for her college studies and her goal is to open a business.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of men's and women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Terisa

texts.en:
Terisa is 37 years old and unmarried, with three children. 

She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Terisa needs a loan to buy a new freezer chest, a cooler, bags of ice, bait, and a new canoe. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Terisa has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer chest, a cooler, bags of ice, bait, and a new canoe

loans.name: Onolata

texts.en:
Onolata is a 34-year-old widow with three children. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Onolata needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new spade, a wheelbarrow, and a new machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. 

Onolata will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new spade, a wheelbarrow, and a new machete

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Primavera está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, una zona que aun se encuentra en crecimiento.  
La Sra. Maria es una de la integrante, ella tiene su pequeño negocio de cantina en la escuela de la zona.  Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de las capacitaciones que irá recibiendo, poder mejorar y tener un mejor estilo de vida y seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra golosinas y otros. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en: The Primavera (Spring) group is in its second loan cycle with the women's community bank program located in the growing city of Curuguaty. Maria is a member of this group who runs her own small canteen in the local school. She hopes in the future, and by means of the support that she will be receiving with this loan, to be able to improve her lifestyle and continue to grow her business. She is applying for this loan to buy sweets and other items to help grow her business and give her family everything they need to live a life free from hardship.

loans.use: To buy sweets and other items

loans.name: San Valentín Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Valentín  todas ellas mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas que quieren salir adelante, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como medio para conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Alicia quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha ido mejorando bastante su estilo de vida y que quiere seguir esforzándose. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que hace desde muy temprano, y que después sale a vender.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, pollo, hortalizas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir haciendo sus comidas.
texts.en:
The group San Valentín is an all women group whose members are hard working, united, and wish to move forward.  They've been carrying out a poverty eradication survey to better learn about each member's life circumstances.  
One of the members is Mrs. Alicia who in the last survey showed a level three poverty level which means that she's been improving her quality of life conditions and wants to strive for better. She sells prepared meals which she prepares early in the morning and later goes out to sell them.  
She's requesting the loan to buy ingredients and materials, including vegetables, meats, and chicken, to keep preparing her meals.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meats, chicken and other materials to prepare food plates for sale.

loans.name: Mefi

texts.en:
Mefi is 25 years old and married, with two children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for seven years. 

Mefi needs a loan to buy crops, chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. 

Mefi will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, and gloves

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is thankful that she was granted a PHP 15,000 loan, which she used to buy planting materials and fertilizer for her farm. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet its daily basic needs.

She would like to apply now for a PHP 50,000 loan that she will use to buy additional farm inputs and fertilizer for a productive harvest on her pineapple farm. 

It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and help her to be able to save to buy a Jeepney, which will easily transport her harvest to the local market. She thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial assistance that will be given to her. 

Gertrudes aims to improve their house and be able to save for her old age.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more planting materials and fertilizer to increase crop yields on her  farm.

loans.name: Gharib

texts.en:
This nice man in the photo is Gharib, who took his first Kiva loan last year. After successfully paying back that loan, this hardworking man asks for another one. 

He plans to further develop his shoe repair service and would like to purchase a sewing machine. 

His loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  Gharib hopes for lenders' support one more time and ensures responsible monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken is involved in construction. He provides roof repair services for local people in Bazum village, Lori region.  Babken is the father of three children.

To purchase needed tools and materials and to be able to cover current orders, Babken has applied for this loan. He plans to use the loan in purchasing  tools and materials needed for roof repair and construction work, and for renovations of his car.

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly ease Babken's work and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for roof repair and construction work, and for renovation of his car

loans.name: Faalagi

texts.en:
Faalagi is a 30 year old woman who is unmarried and has one child. She makes and sells ice-cakes and pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Faalagi needs a loan to buy bags of flour, barrels of cooking oil, salt, pepper, foam cups, cordials and sugar. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

Faalagi joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, barrels of cooking oil, salt, pepper, foam cups, cordials and sugar

loans.name: Jovenes Unidos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jovenes Unidos forman parte del programa de comité de jóvenes, ellos quieren empezar actividades o continuar las que ya tienen, desean poder ayudar a sus familias con su esfuerzo y su sacrificio.
Uno de los integrantes es Ivan, quien se dedica a la venta de repuestos varios, es un joven muy trabajador y que quiere poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo, quiere sentirse útil y así crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de repuestos, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece este préstamo para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group called 'Jovenes Unidos' (United Youth) form a part of their youth committee's program. They want to start various jobs, or continue with those that they already have, to be able to help their families with their effort and sacrifice. 

One of the members is Ivan, who works selling spare parts. He is a very hardworking young man, and wants to be able to help support his family through his work, to feel useful and to grow. 

He asks for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of parts, so that he can continue with his work as he has been doing. For this, he is very thankful with this loan.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts.

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en:
Romanita is 54 years old and married. She is known in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta, for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house.  She has applied for a loan to buy nails, lumber, and plywood for her house and to pay for nipa thatch for roofing. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). 

This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to buy nails, lumber, and plywood for her house and to pay for nipa thatch for roofing

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie is from Oroquieta and is a widower. Eddie owns and operates a sari-sari [convenience] store. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Unfortunately, he almost lost his capital when his wife got a serious sickness that led her to death. PMPC came to Eddie's rescue, enabling him to access financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Eddie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase store inventory and used as additional working capital. This loan will be his third loan from PMPC. He plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase store inventory and used as additional working capital

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
From Oroquieta City, Luzminda earns a living through her clothing sales. She sees to it that she has enough inventory to continuously provide for her family.

PMPC has stood by her for her capital needs since she started her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. In order to earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventory to sell.

She hopes to live comfortably with her children and for them to have their own stable jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventory to sell.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Saratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Irmiya, Babangida, and Joshua.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Saratu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito is from Aloran, he is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He earns a living in his retailing business.

In order to generate more income, Jovito decided to expand his resources after he learned that he can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, he requested a loan to restock more inventory for his store to increase sales.

Jovito smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family with a better life.

loans.use: to restock more inventory for his store to increase sales

loans.name: Eliodoro

texts.es:
El señor Eliodoro se dedica a la compra y venta de productos del hogar, la venta que el realiza es en forma ambulante, se dedica a esta profesión de desde hace 10 años.
Es una persona muy trabajadora que esta saliendo adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y su sacrifico. Pide este préstamo para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad para la venta.
texts.en:
Señor Eliodoro makes his living purchasing and selling home goods. He makes his sales in various locations and he has been working in this trade for ten years.

He is a very hardworking person who is moving his family forward thanks to his effort and sacrifice. He requests this loan for the purchase of basic goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase basic, necessary goods for resale

loans.name: Iliana Elizabeth

texts.es: Iliana de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tarjetas de recargas para celulares desde hace varios años, ella solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de tarjeta de recargas para celulares por mayor para continuar con su trabajo ya que es un producto muy vendible y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Iliana is 31 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and two children.  She has made a living selling refill cards for cellular phones for several years.  

She is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase refill cards for cellular phones at wholesale cost to continue with her work because they are a very salable product. This will enable her to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase refill cards for cellular phones at wholesale cost

loans.name: Anoanoai

texts.en: Anoanoai is a 58-years-old married woman with 7 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 6 years of experience with this business. Anoanoai needs a loan to buy yeast, bags of flour, large pots, barrel of cooking oil, a strainer and an oven. She plans to use her profits to help with her children's school fees. Anoanoai has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy yeast, bags of flour, large pots, barrel of cooking oil, a strainer and an oven.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 19 years old and married with no children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Ana needs a loan to buy gloves, crops, a machete, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and new boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Ana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy gloves, crops, a machete, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and new boots

loans.name: Galulolo

texts.en:
Galulolo is 23 years old and unmarried, with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows kava plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Galulolo needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, plastic bags, barbed wire, boots, and a machete. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. 

Galulolo will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, plastic bags, barbed wire, boots, and a machete.

loans.name: Meatuai

texts.en: Meatuai is a 29 year old single woman with 2 children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Meatuai needs a loan to buy sugar, plastic bags, cordials, sugar, a large cooler and a chest freezer. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Meatuai has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sugar, plastic bags, cordials, sugar, a large cooler and a chest freezer

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mistica está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se han unido para poder luchar por sus familias y por sus seres queridos, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza como un medio de conocer la situación de cada una.
Mirian es una de las integrantes, es una mujer muy humilde, pero por demás trabajadora, se dedica al trabajo de venta de remedios naturales, y por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia en todo lo que tiene a su alcance. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales en cantidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
The group named Rosa Mistica is in its third cycle of the women's committee program. They have united to be able to fight for their families and their dear ones. They also form part of the poverty elimination program as a way for each of their situations to be understood.

Mirian is one of the group members. She is a very humble woman, but she is very hardworking. She makes her living through the sale of natural remedies and through this work, she has the means to be able to help her family with everything that is in her power. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received and that it will be a great help to her. She requests this loan to be able to purchase a large quantity of natural remedies. This way, she can continue with her job and continue fighting to make a living.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies for resale.

loans.name: Faamanu

texts.en: Faamanu is 52 years old and unmarried with 3 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 10 years. Faamanu needs a loan to buy crops, a spade, chemicals, gloves, fertilizer, new boots, a machete and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2004. Faamanu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, a spade, chemicals, gloves, fertilizer, new boots, a machete and a crowbar.

loans.name: Oscar Noe

texts.es: Oscar de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee un joyería ubicada en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logras solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de relojes, baterías, aritos, cadenas, para tener mas productos que ofrecerle a sus clientes y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and three children. He owns a jewelry store located in the municipal market in a very busy area.  With the income he obtains in sales, he is able to cover his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of watches, batteries, earrings, and chains to have more products to offer to his customers and thus to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy watches, batteries, earrings, and chains

loans.name: Olimpio

texts.es:
El Sr. Olimpio, está casado con la Sra. Angelina, tiene dos hijos que aun están en la escuela y por quienes está luchando. El Señor es de profesión taxista desde  aproximadamente 8 años,, es una persona muy honesta y trabajadora que se fue abriendo camino gracias a su esfuerzo. 
Su meta es llegar a adquirir para su propia línea de taxi y ser independiente para así poder generar mayor ingresos y poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder equipar mejor su vehículo taxi, y de esa manera poder seguir con su trabajo, dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Olimpio is married to Señora Angelina, and they have two children who are still in school and for whom they are working hard. Olimpio has been a taxi driver by profession for about 8 years. He is a very honest and hardworking person who has been finding his path through his efforts. 

His goal is to be able to create his own taxi agency and to be independent, to be able to generate higher earnings and be able to bring a better quality of life to his family. 

He asks for this loan to be able to better equip his taxi vehicle, and in this way be able to continue with his work, providing good service to his customers.

loans.use: to equip his taxi vehicle.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma has started her small business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls over her capital to gain more profit. She makes good sales every day since she is the only store in her barangay.

Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

In the future, she hopes to provide a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
This is Marichu, 33, resident of Batasan Hills, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Resty, a bus conductor, and they have one child who is at elementary level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her child to school. 

Marichu has operated a general store for four years already. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells pre-paid loads to mobile subscribers of different telecommunication companies for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, peanut butter, canned goods, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her child to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Marichu hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life. She strives hard to give her child the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as rice, peanut butter, and hot dogs to sell.

loans.name: Meaalofa

texts.en:
Meaalofa is a 48-year-old, married woman with five children. To earn a living, she runs a small bakery in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Meaalofa needs a loan to buy baking trays, a new oven, bags of flour, sugar, baking powder, and icing sugar. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Meaalofa has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011.

loans.use: to buy baking trays, a new oven, bags of flour, sugar, baking powder, and icing sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, pots, a watering hose and gloves.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna has an internet cafe.  She also owns and manages an internet cafe and boarding houses for rental in Ozamiz City, Philippines. She has been doing well for 22 years, supporting the needs of the family. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to buy construction materials for the repair and improvement of her boarding houses so as to provide a safe, comfortable stay and draw more occupants. 

This will help her to continuously sustain the needs of her family, especially her children's education. 

She wants to expand her business and would be happier to have a commercial building in the city.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair and improve her boarding houses, so as to provide a safe, comfortable stay and draw more occupants

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 39 years old; she is married with three children and lives in Ozamiz. Anita and her husband are earning a living through farming. They mastered doing this type of activity when they got married, to support her children's education and their family needs. She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in March, 2014. She is a hardworking mother who has a strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, alleviating poverty. 

Anita requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to have high crop yields on her corn and vegetable farm. This will greatly help Anita boost her income. 

Someday, she hopes to buy land to expand her farming activities, and venture into agri business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to have high crop yields on her corn and vegetable farm

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito has been preparing considerably for the post-harvest operations of his palay in Oroquieta. He wants to ensure that he will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage, and processing of his harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

He presented his proposal to Paglaum MPC and got a loan. Paquito hopes to see all his family with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Ma. Antonia

texts.en:
Ma. Antonia is a 50-year-old married woman from Ozamiz City, Philippines who has three adult age children. She has recently signed up for her membership in PMPC after she learned about the financial assistance it gives. 

Ma. Antonia owns and manages a small restaurant in front of their house, which is on a national road that many people pass through looking for places to eat. Due to the improvements to their city, many people travel in and out of the vicinity, so she has decided to expand her business to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery. 

To fund this project, she needs additional capital, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of meat and spices to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery

loans.name: Siomia

texts.en:
Siomia is a 32-year-old woman who is married with one child. She owns and operates a lawn mowing business to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Siomia needs a loan to buy two lawn mowers, two strokes, petrol, boots, safety glasses and a small second-hand pick-up. 

She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Siomia joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy two lawn mowers, two strokes, petrol, boots, safety glasses and a small second-hand pick-up

loans.name: Vaitoelau

texts.en:
Vaitoelau is a 60-year-old woman, who is married and has seven children. She owns a large plantation, and also a cattle farm to earn some extra money. She has been doing this work for 12 years.

Vaitoelau needs a loan to buy rolls of barbed wire, a pick-up, bags of cement, chemicals and two young calves. She will use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses, and with the expansion of both her businesses. Vaitoelau joined SPBD in 2002, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of barbed wire, a pick-up, bags of cement, chemicals and two young calves

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор по профессии швея. Ей 29 лет. Она живет с мужем, свекровью и двухлетней дочерью в районе Спитамен. Гулбахор ответственный, честный и трудолюбивый человек. На протяжении 5 лет она занимается швейным делом, который приносит ей ежедневную прибыль. Гулбахор шьет в основном женские платья разных фасонов. Ей нравится придумывать дизайны для платьев. Гулабхор в данный момент хочет расшить сферу своих услуг и заняться еще и вышивкой. Для этой цели она берет кредит, на сумму которого собирается приобрести вышивальную машинку. Таким образом Гулбахор сможет увеличить прибыльность своего дела и улучшить качество жизни семьи.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a professional seamstress.  She is 29 years old and she lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and her two-year-old daughter in the region of Spitamen.  She is a responsible, honest and hardworking woman.  She has been involved in sewing for the past five years and she makes some money every day thanks to this activity.  Gulbahor mostly sews various styles of women's dresses.  She likes to think of new designs for the dresses that she makes.  At the moment, Gulbahor would like to expand her field of services, and also offer embroidery services.  In order to achieve her goals, she is taking a loan and will use her money to buy an embroidery machine.  This will make her activity more profitable and will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy  an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 55 and married with eight children in Ozamiz, she runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of their family. Everyday she patiently tends her store. 

Anecita wants to expand her business; she recently signed up for her membership in Paglaum MPC to access insurance and financial assistance. 

Now she has borrowed a loan of PHP 8,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs and those of the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité inicia el séptimo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, cuyo único propósito es poder crecer y Salir adelante para poder dar un mejor estilo de vida a sus familias.
Rosanna es parte de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, se abrió camino gracias a su sacrificio y esfuerzo, ya que sabe que la única forma de poder crecer es luchando y esforzándose. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas y de estación, y comenta que le va bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder abastecerse con una buena variedad de frutas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe ella y sus amigas, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group is beginning its seventh cycle in a program for groups of women. They are women who are the heads of their families, whose only goal is to be able to grow and go forward so that they can give the best lives to their families.

Rosanna is part of this group. She is a very hard-working and persevering woman. She started her journey thanks to her sacrifice and effort, since she knows that the only way to grow is to fight and make an effort. She sells fresh, in-season fruit, and she says that it is going well since she has many clients.

She asks for this loan so that she can stock up on a good variety of fruits. In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales. She is thankful for the opportunity that she and her friends are receiving, and the opportunity will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy various fruits to sell.

loans.name: Agiagia

texts.en:
Agiagia is 22 years old and unmarried, with two children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Agiagia has requested a loan to buy material, designs, stencils, brushes, wooden carved designs, fabric paint, and a cutter.

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2010, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, designs, stencils, brushes, wooden carved designs, fabric paint, and a cutter

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 60 years old and married, with three children. She owns and operates a small flea market, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 13 years. Myra needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles, and Samoan-designed caps.

She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2001, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan-designed caps

loans.name: Tasileta

texts.en:
Tasileta is 55 years old woman and married, with eight children. 

She has a taxi business to earn an income. She has four years with this business. 

Tasileta needs a loan to buy new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil, and petrol. She will use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. 

Tasileta joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil, and petrol

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos es vendedor independiente, tiene un camión para el reparto de sus productos, ya que no tiene un local propio. Sueña con poder tener algún día un negocio fijo para seguir con sus ventas.
Carlos es una persona muy emprendedora, que está luchando para ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Pide este préstamo para la compra de golosinas, galletitas y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos is an independent businessman. He has a truck for delivering his products, since he doesn’t have his own location. He dreams of having a location for his business so that he can continue with his sales.

Carlos is a very enterprising person, who is fighting to improve the conditions of his and his family’s lives. 

He asks for this loan to buy sweets, cookies, and other products. This way, he can continue selling his products.

loans.use: to buy sweets, cookies, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is thankful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan, which she used to maintain her van and to buy more mineral water needed in her business. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan that she will use to maintain her van and to buy gallons of mineral water (where she appears in her photo). It is very important that her van is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service to her customers. Safe water is a household necessity. 

She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help given her.  It will greatly help in sending her child to college. 

Mercedita hopes to serve her water clients well and buy another unit in the future. She aims to give her child the best education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work.  It is where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance for her vehicle and to pay for gallons of mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Oysoat

texts.ru: Ойсоат проживает на районе Дж.Руми. Район был назван в честь великого писателя Джалохиддини Руми и район находится на юго-западной части Республики. Ойсоат замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Как и многие сельские жители Ойсоат занимается растениеводством. На данный момент она готовиться посеять новый урожай и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. На заемные деньги Ойсоат приобретет горючего для трактора, оплатить услуги тракториста и внесет арендную плату за участок земли. Сейчас урожай для Ойсоат все, потому что за счет продажи урожая она приносит в дом доход. Вы можете поддержать Ойсоата.
texts.en: Oysoat lives in the J. Rumy district of Tajikistan, a region named in honor of the famous poet Jalal ad-Din Muhammad Rumi and located in the south-western part of the country.  Oysoat is married and the mother of five children.  Like many rural residents, she is involved in agriculture.  At the moment, she is ready to plant new crops, and for this reason she has requested a loan.  She will use her money to buy fuel for her tractor, to pay the tractor driver's wages as well as the rent for the land. Harvests are extremely important for Oysoat because it is thanks to the sale of her crops that she brings an income home.  Please support her.

loans.use: to buy fuel for her tractor, to pay the tractor driver's wages as well as the rent for the land.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is grateful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a PHP 25,000 loan that she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods that she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. 

Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Gemalyn hopes to grow and expand her business. She aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. She prays for a quiet and happy life for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is thankful that she was granted a PHP 25,000 loan which she used for the maintenance of her jeepney. Through her earnings from her transport service and sale of metal scraps and fragments, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

Rosalie would now like to apply for a PHP 40,000 loan, which she will use to buy metal scraps and fragments to sell at junk shops, as she is shown in her photo, and to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney, as well. 

It is very important that her jeepney is always in a good running condition to ensure continuous, efficient service to her passengers. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment. The financial help that will be given to her will greatly help cover their daily needs and the school needs of her children.  

Rosalie hopes to buy another jeepney unit and to continue her metal scraps business. She aims to give her children the best education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit and to buy metal scraps and fragments to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 41 years old and married, with five children. 

She runs a sewing business and also a fishing business to earn more income. Filomena needs a loan to buy three new sewing machines, thread, needles, measuring tape and a pair of scissors.  As for her fishing business, she'll buy a new canoe and flippers. 

She will use her profits to expand her two businesses and also help with her family financially. Filomena joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy three sewing machines, thread, needles, measuring tape. and scissors; as for her fishing business, she'll buy a new canoe and flippers

loans.name: Mujeres Por Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es:
Este comité llamado Mujeres por un futuro mejor, se unieron para poder trabajar juntas, y por medio de este trabajo ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que por medio de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores pueden conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Odina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, lo que quiere decir que está en un nivel medio. Odina es macatera, es decir, se dedica a las ventas ambulantes de todo tipo de productos, lo que le da muchos clientes es la variedad que siempre tiene, es por ello que pide este préstamo para poder comprar artículos varios para la venta, como ser prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar, y demás.
texts.en:
This group is called “Women for a Better Future.” They meet so that they can work together, and though this work, they are improving the conditions of their and their families’ lives. They are in a program supporting the elimination of poverty; in this program, each member takes a survey to rate her life on 50 measures that capture the circumstances of each member.

One of the members is Mrs. Odina, who, in her last survey, had a poverty level of two, which is a middling level of poverty. Odina is a travelling salesperson, selling all types of products. The factor that earns her many clients is the variety that she always has. 

It is for this that she asks for this loan, so that she can buy various items for sale, including clothing, footwear, retail items, and other things.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, retail items, and other things.

loans.name: Tapunuu

texts.en:
Tapunuu is a 67-year-old widow, with seven children. 

She owns a large cocoa business and also a flea market to earn extra income. She has been doing this for four years. 

Tapunuu needs a loan to buy two chain saws, a weed killer sprayer, chemicals, machetes, a lawn mower, petrol, rolls of barbed wire, and also new hangers for her flea market. 

She will use her profits to pay for her family's daily needs. Tapunuu joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy two chain saws, a weed killer sprayer, chemicals, machetes, a lawn mower, petrol, rolls of barbed wire, and new hangers for her flea market

loans.name: Villa Jardin Group

texts.es:
Descripción	Breve descripción del grupo y luego de una de las miembros. 
El grupo Villa Jardín se formo con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Itá, son mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan por sus seres queridos. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza par a poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delmira es tesorera del comité se encuentra trabajando con la venta de ropas varias dentro de su ciudad, es una mujer emprendedora, se siente conforme con el grupo, ya que siempre recibe capacitaciones.
Pide este préstamo para comprar prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
A brief description of the group and then of one of the members:
The group Villa Jardín was formed by the coming together of several friends and neighbours in the city of Itá. The women are the heads of their families and they fight for their loved ones. They take part in the programme for eliminating poverty so that they can improve their living conditions. 
One of the members is Delmira, she is the treasurer of the committee and she works selling various items of clothing in her city. She is an enterprising woman and she feels happy with the group as she is always receiving training.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy an assortment of clothing items so that she can continue to sell them and therefore increase her income and help her family.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bolts and iron.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Caacupe está en su 2do. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas mantienen una actividad propia emprendidas por ellas mismas, trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante de manera conjunta.
