Angelina es una mujer humilde y trabajadora, ella se dedica al reciclado de artículos varios, como ser cartón, plásticos, aluminio y demás. Ella recorre y junta dichos artículos, que luego vende en cantidad, y por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia. Comenta que esta orgullosa de si trabajo, ya que es por sobre todo muy honesto.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cartones, plásticos y demás, de manera a poder revenderlos y tener una mayor ganancia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
The group “Virgin of Caacupe” is in its second cycle in a program for groups of female entrepreneurs, in which all the members have their own business. They work and help each other go forward together.

Angelina is a humble and hard-working woman. She is dedicated to recycling various items, including cartons, plastics, aluminum, and other things. She goes all over and collects these items, which she then sells wholesale; through this work, she has the means to help her family. She says that she is proud of this work, since, above all, it is very honest.

She asks for this loan to buy cartons, plastic, and other things, so that she can resell them and have more earnings. She is thankful for this opportunity that she has received.

loans.use: to buy cartons, plastics, and other things to resell.

loans.name: Rincon Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rincón Poty está en su 2do. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante para un bienestar propio y para la de su familias, por conservar un bienestar para ellas.
Silvina, una de ellas, es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ella es la presidenta de este grupo y comenta que siempre pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus demás compañeras. Silvina se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa bien surtida que monto con mucho esfuerzo y que hoy ya ha crecido mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de  azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, y de esa forma poder surtir su despensa para seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group “Corner Poty” is in its second cycle in a program for groups of women. All of the women work and help each other go forward for their own wellbeing and for that of their families, and to help maintain their wellbeing.

Silvina, one of the women, is a very hard-working and sacrificing woman. She is the president of this group, and she says that she always puts her best effort into helping the other members. Silvina is dedicated to sales. She has a well-stocked store, that has grown with a lot of effort and that has already grown a lot. 

She asks for this loan to invest in the purchase of sugar, noodles, meat, milk, bread products, rice, drinks, and oil. In this way, she will be able to stock her store to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, meat, milk, bread products, rice, drinks, and oil.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan helped her in business.  She was also able to provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of PHP 50,000. This new loan will go to  maintain  and expand her laundry shop, which she has been operating for five years now. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family if the units being used are regularly maintained and in good condition.

Mylene is hoping to be able to open branches of her shop, and she also wants to try other business opportunities possible. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of their work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of her laundry shop to improve her service for her regular customers.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of PHP 50,000. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. 

Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed on her store. An increase on sales will also result to a significant increase in profit, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her store, Jocelyn also wants for her family to have a good future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of ther work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
As the married mother of two children, Edwina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling coconuts in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store.  Edwina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested this new loan to further build her businesses.

Edwina has sustained her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 32 years old and married, with three children, two of whom are in school. Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 9,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like soft drinks, chips, eggs, milk, sugar, and soap.

Joy has been in this business for 18 years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soft drinks, chips, eggs, milk, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 44 years old and married, with four children, two of whom are in school, Merly works very hard to provide for them.

Merly runs a business buying and selling bamboo in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bamboo to sell.

In the future Merly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bamboo to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive con sus padres en la ciudad de San Ignacio, esta trabajando y a la vez estudia la carrera de derecho. Trabaja para poder ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de sus estudios.
Comenta que su meta es poder terminar su carrera y poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y también poder ayudar a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma seguir sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her parents in the city of San Ignacio, She is working and at the same time she is studying a course in law.  She works in order to help her parents with the costs of her studies.
She states that her goal is to be able to complete her course and to be able the give a better quality of life to her family and also to be able to help society.
She requests this loan to pay the fees for her course, and in this way continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay the university fees.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is grateful that she was granted a PHP 30,000 loan, which she used to pay for grocery items to sell at her general store. Aside from her store she also derives income from her internet shop for more than two years now. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply now for a PHP 50,000 loan that she will use to buy large quantities of groceries, such pasta, eggs, oil, milk, beverages, rice, and other grocery items needed in her store for the Christmas Holidays. Part of the loan she will also use for the maintenance of her computers at her internet shop, where she appears on her photo. 

She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her.

Imelda dreams of having a big grocery store and a bigger internet shop to better serve her clients. She prays for a happy and quiet life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries and to pay for the maintenance of her computers as well.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: bricks, cement, sand and doors in order to put bricks in her kitchen and doors in her house.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers.  Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a PHP 25,000 loan that she will use to buy more direct selling products, such as clothing, footwear, beauty, and skin products to add to her stock and meet Christmas orders of her regular clients. 

Her income from her sales is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her on her investment and for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ophelia dreams of having her own store to display her goods. She aims to give her children the best education possible in order for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell  in her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira hoy tiene 47 años, es una mujer que se destaca por su trabajo y por su esfuerzo, tiene una despensa en la que todos los dias trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde en la noche. Sus hijos son quienes la inspiran para poder seguir con su trabajo.
Comenta que su prestamo anterior lo uso para poder surtir su despensa, hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para comprar mas productos para abastecer su local, con productos como fideos, arroz, azúcar, harina, leche, yerba y otros.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 47 year old woman who stands out for her hard work and her effort. She has a convenience store that she opens very early in the morning and keeps open until late at night. Her children are her inspiration to keep doing her work. 
With the previous loan she was able to stock her store and now she's requesting another loan to buy more products for the store including, milk, flour, sugar, rice, Yerba mate, and noodles, among other items.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, flour, milk, etc.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lanie works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish-vending. Lanie is borrowing PHP 6,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, like meat, vegetables, eggs, and canned goods.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like meat, vegetables, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Yesmin

texts.es:
La señora Yesmin de 33 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 06 años al negocio de venta de golosinas como tacos, enchiladas y tortillas con quesillo, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Yesmin su venta la realiza de forma ambulante en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como carnes, papas, yuca, cebolla, chile, plátanos, condimentos, frescos, agua en bolsa, etc. ya que desea  invertir un poco en su negocio para poder obtener mejores ganancias gracias a que en esta época de navidad  se vende bastante por que hay más empleo en la zona también elabora  nacatamales se venden mucho.
Doña Yesmin con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos su deseo es aumentar más su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Yesmin, 33, is a single mother with three children who depend upon her.  She has been selling snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, and cheese tortillas for 6 years.  She lives in a community within San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.

Doña Yesmin makes her sales on foot in the neighborhoods and communities of San Lorenzo. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of basic ingredients such as meat, potatoes, yucca, onion, chili pepper, plantains, condiments, soft drinks, bottled water, and other such items. 

She wants to invest a little more in her business so that she can achieve better earnings, as the Christmas season is here, and she makes a lot of sales because there is more employment in the zone. She also makes and sells a lot of nacatamales (traditional-style tamales).

Doña Yesmin hopes to improve her income with the support of this loan, and she wants to expand her business.
San Lorenzo, Honduras—October, 2014

loans.use: to purchase meat, potatoes, yucca, onion, chili peppers, plantains, condiments, soft drinks, bottled water, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 35 años de edad, tiene hogar estable, vive con su cónyuge, hijos y al lado de su madre(viuda), viven en casa propia de material rustico de un piso ubicada en caserío Vista Florida, es natural del caserío, él se lleva bien con los miembros de su sector; Santos cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, su vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio; y está ubicada en el distrito de Pimpingos, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Santos es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación está en su cuarto año de producción, cultiva café en caserío Vista Florida, actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café. Adicionalmente cría animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 has. De café en fase de brote floral, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 35 years old and lives in a stable household with his wife and children as well as his widowed mother. They live in their own, one-story house, made of rustic materials. The house is located in Vista Florida hamlet, a native village where Santos was born 35 years ago.
Santos has good personal and commercial references in the area, and his house has running water. The people in his community mainly earn their livings through farming, raising animals, and small businesses. It is located in Pimpingos district, Cutervo province in the mountains of northern Peru. 

Santos’ business is cultivating coffee, and he currently farms 2 hectares with the Catimor variety, which is disease resistant. His plantation is 5 years old and in its 4th year of production. He cultivates coffee in the Vista Florida hamlet in Santo Tomas, and has been doing so for 5 years. He is experienced in the work of growing coffee. He also raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, and hogs) and cultivates a vegetable garden. 

This loan will be used to maintain his 2 hectares of coffee plants, that are beginning to bud at this stage. This will ensure a good harvest for the 2015 season, and result in a larger volume to sell, and thus better income to contribute to the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to maintain 2 hectares of coffee plants that are beginning to bud at this stage, and ensure a good harvest for the 2015 season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and cement and pay for training.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto de 40 años de edad es un hombre admirable que se esfuerza para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar por medio de su negocio de una barbería la cual ha instalado en su vivienda. Él habita en vivienda propia desde hace 5 años al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad. Roberto desea que su negocio le dé mejores ganancias, es por ello que desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: máquina de afeitar, maquina de cortar cabello, cuchillas, tijeras, etc. Para mejorar su negocio de una barbería en su vivienda.
texts.en: Roberto is 40 years old. He is an admirable man that tries to put food on the table everyday for his family through the barber shop that he has set up in his home. He has been living in his own house for 5 years with his wife and his two children who are 17 and 14 years old. Robert wants his business to offer him a better income, and for this reason he would like to obtain a loan from FUSAI to invest in: a shaver, hair clippers, razor blades, scissors, etc. to improve his business of running a barber shop from his home.

loans.use: to invest in: a shaver, hair clippers, razor blades, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 64 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su hijo, quien es mayor de edad, vive en casa propia de material noble de dos pisos ubicada en el distrito Santo Tomas. Mercedes es nacido en caserio El Laurel del distrito santo tomas, se lleva bien los mienbros de su sector, caserio y pobladores del distrito de Santo Tomas; MERcedes cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y stá ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Mercedes es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 haz. Variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su segundo año de producción tiene 3 años de edad, cultiva café en caserio San Jose del distrito de Santo Tomás, actividad la realiza hace 3 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de cafe. Adicionalmente cria animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 has. De café en fase de brote floral, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 64 years old and has a stable home next to her son, who is an adult. She lives in her own, two-story house of quality materials located in the St. Thomas district. Mercedes was born in a small village called El Laurel in the St. Thomas district. She gets along well with the members of her sector and village, and with the settlers of the St. Thomas district. Her community is mainly dedicated to agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade and is located in the St. Thomas district in the Cutervo province, which is found in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. 

Mercedes’ occupation is coffee farming, and to date she has 1 hectare. She farms the Catimor variety that is resistant to disease. Her plantation is in its second year of production, and is three years old. She farms coffee in the San Jose village in the St. Thomas district. She has been in this occupation for 3 years and she has experience in coffee farming. Additionally, she raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and farms staple food crops. 

The purpose of the loan will be for the maintenance and farming of of 1 hectare of coffee, currently in the floral bud stage, ensuring good production for 2015, reflected in a greater volume of sales. In this way, she will have more income and will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to maintain and farm 1 hectare of coffee, currently in the floral bud stage, ensuring good production for 2015.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 59 años de edad, es casado, sin hijos, vive con su familia en este en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Teresa se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad de animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Teresa piensa mejorar su productividad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is 59 years old, married, without children, and lives with her family in a rural zone of the district of Oyotún, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, northern coast of Perú. Her community is mainly dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and business.

Teresa works in the raising and selling of animals, with over ten years of experience in the business. Her business is located in her home. She requests a loan to buy more animals, which will allow her to have a greater diversity of animals, with great influence on the business.

Teresa plans to improve the productivity of the animals in order to be able to tend to the diverse necessities and tastes of her customers, which will allow her within a short time to improve her income, grow her earnings, and thereby better her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals in order to have greater diversity.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer muy dedicada, luchadora, y entregada a su familia, sus padres, su esposo su trabajo. Se desempeña como tendera desde el año 1994 pero ha tenido por estos tiempos algunas dificultades por lo que realizan construcciones y esto ha alejado a sus clientes.

Dichas construcciones han generado algunos deterioros y suciedad en su negocio y aprovechando el cambio que está teniendo su sector, quiere solicitar un crédito para realizar adecuaciones a su negocio como una ampliacion al espacio donde tiene exhibidos sus productos, y capital para comprar insumos en productos de la canasta familiar. 

Su sueño es poder tener un negocio firme para traer hijos en condiciones estables, dignas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a very determined, hardworking woman devoted to her family, parents, husband and job. She has worked as a shopkeeper since 1994, but has had some difficult times completing construction – and this has alienated her customers. Such construction has resulted in some damage and dirt in her business. 

Taking advantage of change happening in the area, she is requesting a loan in order to make adjustments to her business. She hopes to increase the space where she shows and sells her products as well as have additional capital to buy basic goods.  

Her dream is to be able to have a sound business that brings children into stable, dignified conditions.

loans.use: to make adjustments to her business, buy an assortment of basic products and create a financially stable home in order to bring children into the world in dignified conditions.

loans.name: Grinaldi

texts.es: Grinaldi de 48 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos adultos y habita con su cónyuge en San Juan Nepomuceno, municipio del departamento de Bolivar, destacado por la buena comida y la produccción de manualidades, hamacas, mochilas en tejido vertical. Por tradicion familiar y como siempre habia estado involucrada con la buena cocina, pues su madre, hermanos y familiares practican esta actividad, decidió emprender un negocio en un punto comercial de mucha afluencia al público y poco a poco fue adquiriendo reconocimiento de los productos alimenticios de su oferta. Su meta mas adelante es tener un restaurante bien estructurado, y con una buena rentabilidad sobre las ventas,  que en la actualidad corresponde a un 15%. Grinaldi está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, refrescos, frutas, verduras y cárnicos, con los cuales planea incrementar su productividad y sus ventas, aprovechando la temporada decembrina que se acerca y de gran movimiento comercial. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará sustancialmente debido a que hay mas dinero circulante en esta época y mejoran  así las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Grinaldi, 48, is the mother of three adult children.  She lives with her spouse in San Juan Nepomuceno, a town in the department of Bolívar known for good food and the vertical weaving production of handcrafts, hammocks, and backpacks.

By family tradition she had always been involved in good cooking, because her mother, siblings, and family members practice the trade.  She decided to set up a business in a commercial area with a large influx of people, and little by little she acquired recognition for the food products she offered.  Her goal for the future is to have a well-structured restaurant will good sales profitability, which is currently 15 percent.

Grinalia's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy provisions, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables, and meat.  She plans to increase her productivity and her sales, making the most of the upcoming December holiday season.  Her business will improve substantially with this investment because there's more money being spent this time of year, and her business conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy provisions, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables, and meat

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: Martha, identifico que en el barrio que ella reside, ubicado al sur occidente de Barranquilla, no tenían sus vecinos acceso a los servicios de internet por hora o fracción y telefonía por minutos,  razón suficiente para emprender  su café internet, al que agregó una miscelánea, que en la actualidad funcionan en el mismo local.  En su negocio de café internet brinda  servicios de transcripciones e impresión de documentos y recargas a celular y en su miscelánea vende accesorios para el hogar, accesorios femeninos e infantiles y artículos de papelería. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, los cuales están fidelizados con el excelente servicio que ella les brinda.  Las compras las realiza a mayoristas de Barranquilla, a quienes les cancela de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cosméticos y artículos para surtir el negocio de miscelánea, como accesorios femeninos, papelería, adornos navideños etc, esta inversión incrementará las utilidades, ya que se acerca la temporada decembrina en la que la demanda de estos artículos aumenta y es importante tener el stock necesario para impactar la clientela e impulsar su decisión de compra. Martha tiene 26 años de edad y sueña con tener a futuro su propio apartamento;  su desafío es continuar brindando un excelente servicio, para que la clientela continúe fidelizada y así poder aumentar la cobertura y tener más equipos a disposición de su distinguida clientela
texts.en:
Martha noticed that people in her neighborhood, located on the southwest of Barranquilla, did not have access to Internet nor phone per hour/minutes so she started an Internet cafe. She later added a small shop in the same space.
Her Internet cafe provides typing and printing services and prepaid cards for cell phones. In the shop she sells home, women, and children accessories and stationery articles. Her main clients are friends and neighbors which form a loyal customer base due to the excellent service she provides. She buys her products at wholesale distributors in Barranquilla which she pays cash. 
She's requesting her first loan from Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will buy cosmetics and other items to stock her shop. She will also buy women's accessories, stationary articles and Christmas decorations, among other products to be well prepared for the Christmas season when demand increases and it's important to maintain the shop well stocked so that clients find what they need and sales increase.
Martha is 26 years old and her dream is to have her own apartment. Her challenge and motivation is to keep providing an excellent service to keep her loyal customer base and increase her coverage and the equipment available fo her clients.

loans.use: buy cosmetics, female accessories, stationary items, and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Navia

texts.es: Navia de 55 años de edad, habita en Soledad, municipio área metropolitana de Barranquilla, donde se dedica a la comercialización de productos de aseo personal, y cremas para nutrir la piel. Hace 16 años en Julio de 1977 empezó su negocio, cuando un amigo le habló del proyecto de participación en una empresa que comercializa mediante el multinivel a más de 450 artículos.  Navia es muy atenta y trabaja en horas de la tarde , vendiendo a crédito y de contado, a clientes ubicados en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su meta es lograr el nivel más alto en su estructura de negocio, para incrementar así mismo sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de aseo personal y cremas capilares, que benefician la nutrición de la piel de los consumidores. Con esta inversión logrará incrementar sus ingresos y tener un inventario voluminoso, que exhibido impactara la atención, el interés, el deseo y  la acción de compra de su clientela actual y potencial, mejorando así las condiciones de su negocio, para poco a poco alcanzar su meta familiar de calidad de vida .
texts.en:
Navia, 55 years old; lives in Soledad, a municipality in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla where she sells personal care products and body lotions. It was 16 years ago that a friend told her about participating in a company that sells through the multilevel market more than 450 products. This company started in 1977 and offers many items.  Navia is very attentive and works hours in the afternoon. She sells on credit or for cash to her customers located in the city of Barranquilla. Her goal is to achieve the highest level in her business structure, to increase her income and improve her quality of life. 

She is currently applying for a credikiva, the first request she makes to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy personal care products and hair creams through the company, which will benefit her customer’s skin nutrition. With this investment she will increase her income and have a large inventory, which when on display will influence the attention, interest and desire and the act of purchasing of her current and potential customers thus improving the condition of her business so that little by little she will accomplish her family’s goal of quality of life.

loans.use: buy personal care products and hair creams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopier and diversify her services to the community.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin tiene 62 años, tiene siete hijos, todos ya mayores, que con sacrificio pudo sacar adelante junto con su esposa. Él emprendió su actividad hace más de 20 años como ganadero vende por las zonas aledañas y hoy día ya tiene una buena clientela.
Fermin es un señor muy  trabajador y sacrificado, tuvo que pasar por varios obstáculos para logar todo lo que actualmente posee.
Necesita el préstamo para la compra de animales siendo que empieza la temporada de venta alta y donde más demandas tiene
texts.en:
Fermín is 62 years old and has seven children, all adults now. With a lot of sacrifices he was able to get them ahead in life, alongside his wife. He started his career as a cattle rancher over 20 years ago. He began selling in the neighboring areas and nowadays has a good clientele. Fermín is a hard working and selfless man. He has overcome various obstacles to achieve everything he currently has.

He needs the loan to buy animals, since the high season is starting and it’s when there is more demand.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Samy Vianey

texts.es: Samy,  inició en su negocio con una pequeña venta de minutos a celulares, luego compró una vitrina mostrador de productos y poco a poco ha ido reinvirtiendo su capital, con la finalidad de generar ganancias a corto plazo, para apoyar a su cónyuge con el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar.   Su negocio funciona desde su casa, ubicada en un barrio del municipio del Atlántico desde el año 2012 y en él ofrece minutos, golosinas, detalles para diversos eventos, ropa  y artículos de marroquinería.  Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, a quienes vende de contado, así como sus compras las realiza a comerciantes del centro de la ciudad, a quienes les cancela de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará ropa y detalles, para aprovechar la temporada decembrina en la cual requieren mucho de estos productos, pero también recogerá un saldo que debe a una entidad crediticia.  Samy  tiene 27 años y desea tener su casa propia, pero su gran desafío es mejorar su stock de producto y ser apoyada por parte de entidades de crédito, para poder generar inversión y rentabilidad, pues a  futuro planea tener una gran miscelánea fruto del esfuerzo de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Samy started a small scale business selling cell phone minutes; then she bought a glass display case for her goods and has been slowly reinvesting her capital with the goal of generating short term income in order to help her husband support the household. Since 2012 she has been running her business from her home located in a neighborhood in the town of El Atlantico. In it, she sells cell phone minutes, sweets and items for various events, clothing and leather goods. Her principal clients are her neighbors, friends and relatives to whom she makes cash sales.  She makes her purchases from merchants in the city’s center and pays in cash.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will use to purchase clothing and other items to take advantage of the December season during which she will require many of these products. She will also settle a balance that she owes a lender.

Samy is 27 years old and wants to have her own home, but her greatest challenge is to improve her stock of products and to be supported by lenders so that she can generate investments and profitability. In the future she plans to have a large corner shop as the fruit of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and other items.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Los pueblos son privilegiados cuando hay manos masculinas detrás de cualquier producción, las esposas se sienten muy apoyadas por esposos así, que se dedican además de los trabajos diarios  también se dedican a realizar actividades que les genera una ganancia extra para mejorar el futuro de su familia.

Pascual es casado de 37 años de edad,  tiene un hijo de 6 año, es el motivo que lo a motivado a realizar actividades en su comunidad donde el vive para tener un ingreso económico para el sustento de su familia.

A la actividad que el se dedica es a la venta de granizadas por todo los alrededores de su  comunidad, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante más de 16 años  porque para el es una fuente importante de ingresos para poder sustentar a su familia y en un futuro darle educación a su hijo para que llegue a profesional en la vida.

El uso respectivo que dará el préstamo es para la compra de una congeladora par la buena realización de su labor y que sus productos de granizadas sean vendidas a las personas por los alrededores de su comunidad, para así obtener más ganancias en el futuro, los sueños de el es brindarle estudios a su hijo para que el llegue a ser un buen profesional en la vida y ampliar mas su negocio de venta de granizadas.
texts.en:
Towns are privileged to have masculine hands behind any production. The wives feel very supported by husbands such as this: those who work not only at their daily jobs, but also work to generate extra earnings in order to improve their family's future.

Pascual is married and is 37 years old. He has a 6-year-old child; this is what has motivated him to work within the community where he lives to have economic earnings in order to sustain his family.

He sells shaved ice ("granizados") all over the community. He has been doing this work for more than 16 years because it is an important source of income that helps him to support his family - and, in the future, to give his son an education so that he can become a professional in life.

The loan will be used for the purchase of a freezer so that he can do his job well, and so that his shaved ice products will be sold to the people in his community. In this way, he will have more future earnings. His dreams are to provide his son with an education so that he will become a good professional in his life, and to increase his snow cone business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 43 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, buena madre, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por el comercio y la manufactura en todas las áreas, de clima calido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía en el día desde 18-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Elizabeth es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español por el comercio. Vive junto a su pareja que se dedica al transporte y a sus dos hijos, los cuales estudian en la escuela, su casa es propia y está construida de ladrillo, cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte ”taitetú” frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), etc. su restaurante se encuentra ubicado en su casa, tiene muchos clientes constantes y es un negocio prospero “mi negocio mejora porque los clientes me conocen y son constantes, algunos están pensionados y comen todos los días aquí…”. Su sueño es tener un auto propio donde transportar las verduras e insumos de cocina, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. Esta es la tercera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en cinco años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas e insumos de cocina para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 43 year old married woman who has two children ages 5 and 15 years of age. Her business is selling traditional food. She is independent, entrepreneurial, a good mother, constant, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in the southern zone of the city, in an area known for business and all kinds of manufacturing. The climate there is warm, tropical, and humid, with a temperature that varies from 18-35 degrees centigrade all year round.

Elizabeth is short, has a dark complexion and dark long curly hair. She dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, layered skirt) and her first language is Aymara and her second language which she uses in business is Spanish. She lives with her children and husband, who works in transportation. Her children study in school. They own their brick home, and the home has potable water and electricity service. Her business is selling traditional foods such as majadito de charque (dehydrated meat, rice, fried egg and fried plantain), locro carretero cruceño (soup of dehydrated meat, chopped meat, yucca, and egg), Cogote relleno (chicken neck stuffed with potato), etc. Her restaurant is located in her home and she has many regular customers and it is a profitable business. "My business will grow because my customers know me and are regulars. Some are retired and they eat here every day..."

Her dream is to have her own car where she can transport her vegetables and kitchen supplies. She wishes to expand her business by buying tables and chairs in order to serve a greater number of customers. It is for these reasons Maria seeks a loan to buy tables and chairs and kitchen supplies to better serve a larger number of customers.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and kitchen supplies to serve a greater quantity of customers.

loans.name: Walter Marcelo

texts.es: Walter tiene 22 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura ya que no cuenta con un trabajo estable. Vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar en la comunidad Pucara. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes para empezar a sembrar maiz y obtener una producción buena ya que es la única actividad que realiza y sale adelante gracias a la agricultura. Realiza las compras en san pablo cada 8 días por que no existe transporte frecuentemente, su sueño es aumentar la producción de los cultivos,le gusta hacer deporte en sus tiempos libres y las fiestas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Walter is 22 years old and makes a living as a farmer since he does not have a stable job. He lives in San Miguel, a province in Bolivar, in the Pucara community.

He is requesting a loan to purchase organic compost and fertilizer in order to start planting corn so that he will have a good harvest since the only work he does to get ahead is farming. He makes his purchases in San Pablo every 8 days because frequently there is no transportation.

His dream is to increase production in his fields. 

He enjoys playing sports in his spare time and also the celebrations in his community.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the locale of his shoe store.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está casado,  vive con sus hijos y su esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación en desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo en plantaciones de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en el cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: José Francisco is 36 years old, married, and lives with his children and wife, who are his greatest priority. With the loan he intends to buy fertilizer and other products to apply to his coffee crop. In addition he will pay for labor to apply the products and assist the plantation in its development, and in this way he will assure himself good work.  He wants to take advantage of the good weather and soil in the area for this crop, and also put into practice his years of experience in managing coffee plantations. In addition he will be able to buy the best quality products so that his plantation grows well and is healthy, resulting in an adequate harvest. Having a good production is important. With the income from the harvest he hopes to obtain, he wants to use it for the well-being and education of his family, and meet some family goals, and continue investing in his crops. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He didn't have any loans from the state bank, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with ease and much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other products to apply to his coffee crop.

location.town: Calle Mora Arriba de Río Nuevo

loans.name: Sulimauga

texts.en: Sulimauga is 54 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for five years. Sulimauga needs a loan to buy a new chest freezer, canned items, shoes, a display fridge, snacks, frozen goods, and candy. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new chest freezer, canned items, shoes, a display fridge, snacks, frozen goods, and candy

loans.name: Alain

texts.en:
Alain is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alain is 30 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Alain has a buy and sell herbal products business in the Philippines. Alain requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of herbal products to sell.

Alain has been in this business for five years. In the future, Alain would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Charry

texts.en:
Charry is 28 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by buying and selling pigs in the Philippines. Charry is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to sell.

Charry has been buying and selling pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell

loans.name: Servillina

texts.en:
Servillina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Servillina is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Servillina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Servillina requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Servillina has been in this business for one year. Servillina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 51 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Teresita has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of firewood to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three pigs and cement for pigsty construction to start commercial pig production.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es: Don Ezequiel tiene un pequeño taller de venta y repuestos de equipos agrícolas. Ésta es el único taller en la comunidad y ya tiene 3 años de tenerlo. en estas épocas navideñas aumenta el consumo y la venta de estos productos, es por esto que él necesita un préstamo de un millón de colones para poder comprar mas equipos y ponerlos a la venta. Para él este préstamo le permitirá poder mejorar las ventas de su negocio y ayudar a seguir teniendo buenos resultados que le permiten dar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Ezequiel owns a small shop where he sells and repairs farming equipment. It is the only shop in the community, and he's run it for three years. 

During Christmas season, there is an increase in the use and sales of these products. This is why he needs a loan of one million colones to buy more equipment to sell.

This loan will allow him to increase sales, and to continue achieving good results which allow him support his family.

loans.use: to sell farming equipment.

loans.name: Tilson Manuel

texts.es:
Desde muy temprano Tilson abre las puertas de su pequeño negocio donde encontraras una amplia variedad de productos. Tilson decidió instalar su propio negocio para dejar de trabajar de capataz en fincas y también para poder estar en su hogar cuidando de sus tres hijos de 14, 10 y 6 años, porque de esa manera podrá ser el quien vele por la educación y cuido de sus hijos. Tilson ha logrado mantener una amplia clientela y su negocio ahora es muy conocido como un punto de referencia de pulpería donde podrás encontrar de todo, debido a la variedad de productos que oferta, ha obtenido mayores ingresos y ha aumentado y diversificado su pulpería.
Productos ordenados, excelente atención y una sonrisa cálida es lo que reciben los clientes al entrar a la pequeña pulpería de Tilson, se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta, responsable, decorosa y trabajador. Solicita el crédito para diversificar sus productos y poder aumentar la cantidad de los mismos,necesita el credito para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, medicamentos y cosméticos, de esa manera responderá a las demandas de sus clientes, quienes siempre piden algo nuevo, el financiamiento le facilitara fortalecer sus ganancias, así como el incremento de estas. Deposita su confianza en la respuesta del crédito, que le ayudara a mantener su estabilidad económica en su familia.
texts.en:
Very early, Tilson opens the doors of his small business where you will find a wide variety of products. Tilson decided to open his own business in order to stop working as a farm foreman and so that he would be able to stay at home and care for his three children who are 14, 10 and 6 years old. In this way he will be able to be the person who sees to his children’s education and welfare.

Tilson has managed to maintain a broad customer base and his business is very well known as a place where you can find everything due to the variety of products that he offers. He has earned a higher income and expanded and diversified his small store.  Well organized products, excellent service and a warm smile are what greet customers when they enter Tilson’s small store. 

Tilson is characterized as being an honest, responsible, dignified and hardworking person. He is requesting the loan to diversify his products and to expand his offerings. He needs a loan to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, medicine and cosmetics. In this way he will be able to meet the demands of his customers who are always asking for something new. The funding will facilitate and strengthen his profits as well as increase them. He puts his faith in the loan, which will help him to maintain the economic stability of his family.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, medicine and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is a 52-year-old single lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells secondhand men's clothes, and at the same time owns rentals as an additional source of income.

She faces challenges of competition. However, she has hopes of having a lot of profits from her business and expanding it to new areas.

Jolly has asked for a loan to buy men's suits to sell during this festive season.

loans.use: to buy men's suits to sell during this festive season.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 44 years old and she lives in the village Zovaber of the Gegharkunik region in Armenia. Gayane lives with her mother-in-law and two school-aged children. Her husband is temporarily in the Russian Federation where he does different construction work and from time to time transfers money to his family. 

In her village, Gayane is engaged in farming and agriculture. Her farm is a very cute one. Since she does everything about it alone, she only just manages to take care of her house, her children, her plot of land and also her farm cattle. In her farm she has a cow and 10 chickens. So it is obvious that the income from her farm products is greatly limited. She sells little milk, macun (national dairy product) and fewer eggs. On her plot of land Gayane cultivates potatoes and greens. As Gayane says her family’s living conditions are far from being good and she is very upset that she cannot improve it somehow.

Now her only hope is this Kiva loan, with which she intends to buy a lot of potato seedlings (it is very cheap in this period of time). This is the best selling vegetable from this region. That may bring some income to her family. She will store these seedlings and plant them in the very early spring.

loans.use: to buy a lot of potato seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three pigs and cement for pigsty construction to start commercial pig production.

loans.name: Basudev

texts.en: Basudev owns a small food stall where he sells food items but he wants to improve his stall by adding cold drinks and milk-made perishable foods. Also, he has to repair his showcase so that he can display his items to attract the customers. He is a 31-year-old differently-able man who resides with his wife and two children in a small village in the Anugul District in Odisha. He requested a loan to pay for showcase repairing and to purchase a fridge to sell cold drinks and perishable foods. By expanding his business, he wants to earn more money to send his children to school and he wants to live a happy life. He has a dream of providing a secure life for his children.

loans.use: to pay to repair a showcase and to purchase a refrigerator to sell cold drinks and perishable goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs and cement for the  construction of a pigsty to start commercial pig production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies, groceries, vegetables, meat products, dairy products, cold meats, etc. for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and cement to construct a pigsty to start commercial pig production

loans.name: Tanuvasa

texts.en:
Tanuvasa is a 52-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells popcorn and Samoan fried chips in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. 

She needs a loan to buy barrels of cooking oil, pots, loads of taro, corn seeds, a frying pan, a new oven, and a gas bottle. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's daily needs and also help with the expansion of her business. Tanuvasa has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy barrels of cooking oil, pots, loads of taro, corn seeds, a frying pan, a new oven, and a gas bottle

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is a 55-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small bakery and a plantation in her community to earn a living. She has six years of experience with these businesses. 

She needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, and cooking oil for her bakery and machetes and a new wheelbarrow for her plantation. Beauty plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Beauty has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, and cooking oil for her bakery and  machetes and a new wheelbarrow for her plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to give a boost to her business by investing in merchandise, since this is her only livelihood for covering her expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, pots, plastic bags, corn seeds, a bag of salt, and a barrel of butter

loans.name: Fofoga

texts.en:
Fofoga is a 52 year old married woman with 6 children. She makes and sells Samoan fried chips in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

She needs a loan to buy barrels of cooking oil, loads of taro and bananas, plastic bags, a strainer, and a large pot. She plans to use her profits to help with her family's weekly expenses and also for the expansion of her business. Fofoga has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy barrels of cooking oil, loads of taro and bananas, plastic bags, a strainer, and a large pot

loans.name: Elean

texts.en:
Elean is 35 years old and married with four children.

Elean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like cereals, shampoo, fabric conditioners, candies, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Elean has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Elean aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like cereals, shampoo, fabric conditioners, candies, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Paepae

texts.en:
Paepae is 22 years old and unmarried with one child. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for five years. 

She has requested a loan to buy rolls of material, fabric paint, wooden carved designs, stencils, a cutter, and rubber designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, fabric paint, wooden carved designs, stencils, a cutter, and rubber designs

loans.name: Salote

texts.en:
Salote is 19 years old and single with no children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. 

She has requested a loan to buy a cutter, stencils, a table, brushes, rollers, fabric paint, and wooden carved designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a cutter, stencils, a table, brushes, rollers, fabric paint, and wooden carved designs

loans.name: Maliasoli

texts.en:
Maliasoli is 40 years old and married with six children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

She needs a loan to buy fertilizer, pots, chemicals, sprayers, safety glasses, overalls, and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Maliasoli will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pots, chemicals, sprayers, safety glasses, overalls, and a machete

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Famela is 18 years old and is the second of the two children in the family. Her mother Elsa, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Famela is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education, and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Elsa is borrowing PHP 7,000 to pay for the tuition fees of her daughter Famela, for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Famela plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been in pig fattening for three years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream; to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Augusta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 31 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Augusta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marestela

texts.en:
Marestela is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marestela is 31 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines. Marestela requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods like shoes, sandals, blouses, shorts, etc. to sell.

Marestela has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods like shoes, sandals, blouses, shorts, etc., to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 43 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Veronica is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been in pig fattening for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines. Erma has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Erma has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and her two children are in school.

Eva has buys and sells frozen foods in the Philippines. She has requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Eva has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 42-year-old married woman from Alyamon, a village near Jenin City. She is a mother with two sons and two daughters. Her sons work as construction workers, with low incomes and long hours of hard work. Her daughters are students.

Ilham would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the things they need. She has requested a USD loan from FATEN to help her to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Ilham will be able to provide hot water for the family home without using electricity.

Ilham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Jebreel

texts.en:
Jebreel is a 24-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his wife and two kids, a son and a daughter. He has a barber shop in the city. It is a good business but the income is not stable.

Jebreel would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the things they need. He has requested a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Jebreel will be able to provide hot water for the family home without using electricity.

Jebreel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from fish vending. 

Evelyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, and spices for her food production business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, and spices for her food production business

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Celsa is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Celsa has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Celsa requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Celsa has been in this business for 25 years. Celsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 64 years old and married with thirteen children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Cresencia has a general store business in the Philippines. Cresencia requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Cresencia has been in this business for 21 years. Cresencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Malili

texts.en: Malili is 49 years old and unmarried with seven children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. Malili has requested a loan to buy stencils, brushes, rollers, rubber designs, fabric paint and rolls of material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy stencils, brushes, rollers, rubber designs, fabric paint and rolls of material

loans.name: Faasami

texts.en: Faasami is a 46-year-old widow with eight children. She collects coconuts from her plantation and sells them in community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Faasami needs a loan to buy three wheelbarrows, a machete, a crowbar, new overalls, gloves, boots and a tarpaulin. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Faasami will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy three wheelbarrows, a machete, a crowbar, new overalls, gloves, boots and a tarpaulin

loans.name: Deily

texts.es: Deilyn es una joven muy esforzada, ella tuvo un préstamo para poder vender las artesanías que fabrica, ahora ella está necesitan construir una pequeña casa para vivir en un terreno familiar. Es por esto que ella necesita de un préstamo de un millón de colones para comprar los materiales necesarios para construirla. Con esto ella podrá tener su propia casa lo que le permitirá mejorar su situación familiar y seguir adelante con sus proyectos.
texts.en: Deilyn is a hard-working young person. She had a loan in order to be able to sell handcrafts that she makes, and now she needs to build a small house to live on the family land. It is for this that she needs a loan of one million colones to buy the necessary materials to construct it. With this, she will be able to have her own house. This will allow her to improve her family situation and to move forward with her projects.

loans.use: to construct a home.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is thankful that she was granted a 9,000 PHP loan, which she used to pay for her direct selling of personal products. This helped her support her family and meet their daily basic needs. To augment her income, she now sells processed meat products, which also makes good income.

She would like now to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy dozens of processed-meat food products. She will sell and meet the orders and increased demand of sweetened and garlic meat products in preparation for the Christmas Holidays. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Lolita dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit.  She prays for good health and to have savings for her old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for processed meat such as hot dogs, "tocino," and "longanisa" to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 20-year-old woman who lives in Jerash. She is studying for her bachelor's degree, and is now in her second year. Income that comes from a job and her father and her brother is not enough to pay her fees. Low family income led her to apply for an educational loan to help cover her semester fees. Sarah's plan in the future is to get a job in the same field.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: Filipina is a 61-year-old widow with five children. She runs a small plantation and a tailoring business in the community to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Filipina needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, new gum boots and a spade. As for her tailoring business, she'll be buying thread, material and a new sewing machine. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Filipina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, new gum boots and a spade for farming and for her tailoring business she'll be buying thread, material and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sooaso

texts.en: Sooaso is 53 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for eight years. Sooaso has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, a cutter, gloves, stencils, brushes, rollers, a table, wooden carved designs and rolls of material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, a cutter, gloves, stencils, brushes, rollers, a table, wooden carved designs and rolls of material

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is a 29-year-old unmarried woman with one child. She makes and sells Samoan fried chips in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience in this business. Christina needs a loan to buy pots, barrels of cooking oil, a new oven, plastic bags, salt and seasoning. She plans to use her profits to help with the expansion of her business. Christina has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy pots, barrels of cooking oil, a new oven, plastic bags, salt and seasoning

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is a 29-year-old married man from Yatta, a village near Hebron city. He is the father of two sons and one daughter. 

Two years ago, Mousa opened his own business which is a carpentry workshop. He makes different types of home furniture and sells them in his store. It is a very profitable business but the cost of the raw materials is very high. Mousa took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more wooden bars for his carpentry. By taking this loan, Mousa will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. 

Mousa appears in the photo while he is working.

loans.use: to buy more wooden bars for his carpentry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for the farm.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Es un día muy caluroso, el mercado mayor de Sololá está repleto de personas que van y vienen, unos comprando otros vendiendo.  La esperanza baila entre los dos grupos. Entre esos grupos se encuentra Francisca de 67 años de edad, ella realiza un enorme esfuerzo para sostener a su familia ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad ella es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes sueños en la vida.

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de verduras, ella eligió dicha actividad porque le genera ingresos económico para su familia, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante 15 años y lo aprendió de su mama, a ella le gusta realizar esta actividad porque por medio de ello a mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia y también la de su comunidad. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la siembra de cebolla en un terreno que tiene disponible en su comunidad.

El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito es para la compra de verduras y fertilizantes para así mejorar sus siembras para obtener buenas cosechas y mejorar sus ventas en el mercado de su comunidad con buenas cosechas. La aspiración de ella es agrandar su negocio y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
It is a very warm day, and Sololá's central market is full of people coming and going - some buying, some selling. Hope dances between the two groups. Within these groups you can find Francisca, who is 67 years old. She works incredibly hard to support her family. She has 4 children, all of whom are students at the community school. She is an enterprising woman with big dreams.

Francisca buys and sells vegetables. She chose this job because it generates income for her family. She has been conducting this work for 15 years, and she learned it from her mother. She likes this work because, through it, she has improved her family's living conditions, as well as those of the community. The second type of work she does is to grow onions in a community plot. 

She will use the loan to buy vegetables and fertilizers. Therefore, she will improve her crops and have good harvests, as well as improving her sales in her community market due to the good harvests. Her aspiration is to improve her business and to build houses for her children so they can have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Махмуд жизнерадостный парень 43 лет. Он женат  и имеет двоих детей. У Махмуд нет высшего образования. Махмуд и его семья живут в сельской местности.
В данный момент Махмуд работает водителем. Он занимается развозкой пассажиров. Ему нравится его работа. От данного дела Махмуд имеет неплохой доход. В данный момент Махмуд хочет получить кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля. За помощью он обратился в МДО Арванд. Он благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Mahmud is a happy 43-year-old. He is married and has two children. Mahmud does not have a higher education. Mahmud and his family live in a rural area. At the present time, Mahmud works as a driver. He is involved in transporting the passengers. He likes his work. Mahmud earns a good income from this business. Currently, Mahmud wants to obtain a loan to repair his car. He came to MDO Arvand for help. He thanks Arvand for the support and relies on a positive result.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a machine for laying flagstones

loans.name: Jesús Enrique

texts.es: Jesús, inicio trabajando en un negocio familiar, donde adquirió la experiencia necesaria para el funcionamiento de su negocio, el cual funciona desde el año 2006, que consiste en un taller que presta servicios de reparación de motos y bicicletas y funciona en un sector muy transitado al sur occidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla; sus principales clientes son transeúntes del sector, conductores y/o propietarios de motocicletas, que prestan servicios de transporte y empleados cuyo medio de transporte son estos vehículos. El taller de Jesus, presta sus servicios en el horario de 8 a.m. a 7 p.m., de lunes a sábado, lo cual corresponde a 11 horas diarias.
