Los repuestos para motocicletas y bicicletas,  los compra de contado en almacenes especializados que venden al por mayor. Este negocio maneja un buen flujo de caja, puesto que sus servicios los cancelan de contado en el momento de la prestación del servicio, el cual desea mejorar,  por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una rectificadora de cilindro para su negocio, con la cual alcanzar más calidad en su oferta.  Jesús es padre de 1 niño de 5 años y dos niñas de 3 y 10 años de edad, a quienes desea brindarle estudios y un mejor futuro.  Sus metas a nivel del negocio son aumentar la capacidad de sus servicios y por eso se prepara diariamente con capacidad de trabajo para así lograr sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Jesús started working at a family business in which he acquired the necessary experience to start his own business which has been opened since 2006. He operates a motorcycle and bicycle repair shop located in a very busy area on the southwest of the city of Barranquilla.  His main clients are people from the neighborhood, car drivers or motorcycle owners who work in the transportation business and employees who use these type of vehicles. He works 11 hours a day from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. from Monday to Saturday.  
He buys the motorcycle and bicycle replacement parts cash at specialized wholesale warehouses. His business has good cash flow given that the clients pay cash at the time of service. He wants to improve his business so he's requesting his first loan from Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a cylinder boring machine with which to increase the quality of his services. 
Jesús has a 5 year old son and two daughters of 3 and 10 years of age whom he wants to give the opportunity to study and strive for a better future. His goal for the business is to increase his work capacity and he prepares everyday for that purpose so that he can obtain the success that he envisions.

loans.use: buy a cylinder boring machine.

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.ru:
Санобар жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 29 лет. Санобар  замужем. Она не имеет пока детей. У Санобар нет высшего образования. Она живет со своей семьей в сельской местности.
Санобар занимается своим бизнесом. Она покупает на рынках скот,  ухаживает за ним некоторое время, а когда скот немного подрастает продаёт его. Получает Санобар от этого дела не плохой доход. Сейчас Санобар хочет увеличить количество скота и купить корм для них на зиму. Для этого она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Санобар заранее благодарит нашу организацию за поддержку и надеется положительный результат.
texts.en:
Sanobar is a lively and hard-working young woman. She is 29 years old and married. She has no children so far. Sanobar did not go to college. She lives with her family in a rural area.

Sanobar has her own business. She buys cattle at various markets, takes care of them for a period of time while they grow, and then resells them. She earns a decent income this way. At present Sanobar would like to increase her cattle headcount and also buy cattle feed for the winter. This is why she has applied to Arvand for a loan. Sanobar thanks Arvand in advance for its support and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Cindy Johana

texts.es: La emprendedora mujer llamada Cindy, comenzó a forjar su negocio vendiendo llamadas y recargas, hoy día es un negocio con diversidad de servicios; con el apoyo de su conyugue quien le aporto capital para iniciar un almacén miscelánea, funcionan también un café internet y una venta de helados.  Sus compras las realiza de contado a sus proveedores y atiende de lunes a domingo en el horario de 8 a.m. a 8 p.m. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual invertirá en ropa, calzado, recargas, helados, e insumos para fotocopiado, estas compras se están realizando para aprovechar la temporada decembrina, en la que se incrementa la demanda de estos productos y hace que sus ventas impacten su economia doméstica. Cindy tiene 25 años, reside en la casa de sus suegros, estudió mercadeo y ventas y es madre de una niña de 9 años a quien desea brindarle un mejor futuro.  Su desafío es capitalizar su negocio, para generar mayor inversión y continuar prosperando.
texts.en:
Cindy is an enterprising woman who started her business selling phone cards and calling card refills, and now days, her business offers a variety of services. With the support of her spouse, who provided her with capital, she opened a small general store that serves as both an internet café and an ice cream shop.  She makes her purchases with cash from her suppliers, and her store is open from 8:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. Monday to Sunday.  

She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it, she will invest in clothing, footwear, calling card refills, ice cream, and photocopy supplies.  She is making these purchases in time to make the most of the Christmas season, when the demand for these products increases, and her sales have an impact on her household finances.  

Cindy is 25 years old, and she lives in her parents-in-laws’ home.  She studied marketing and sales, and she has a nine-year-old daughter, for whom she wants to provide a better future.  Her challenge is to fund her business in order to generate more investment and continue prospering.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, calling card refills, ice cream, and photocopy supplies.

loans.name: Jose Ivan

texts.es:
José, es un joven estudiante de SENATI, que vive junto a sus padres y su hermana en la  ciudad de Lima. Sus padres se encuentran laborando de manera eventual en una fábrica, lo que no les permite tener ingresos mensuales fijos para así poder solventar los gastos de estudios de sus 2 hijos.

José estudia actualmente Electrónica Industrial, y está cursando el 3er. Ciclo de la Carrera, anteriormente. Él también trabaja pero de manera muy eventual como archivador de documentos, pero debido a los horarios de la Carrera y de su Trabajo, tuvo que dejar de trabajar para poder continuar con sus estudios, es por eso que está buscando el apoyo de KIVA para poder culminar sus estudios sin ningún problema. 

De no ser por el apoyo de KIVA, José  tendría que dejar sus estudios, ya que se dedicaría solo a trabajar para poder reunir el dinero suficiente que le permita completar sus estudios. 

José agradece mucho el apoyo que brinda KIVA a través de IPFE por medio del Crédito Educativo, ya que es una acción admirable porque le permite a jóvenes como él a cumplir sus sueños de ser un excelente profesional. Su mensaje que nos deja es que existen muchas oportunidades para acabar los estudios, solo se necesita tener interés y paciencia para conseguirlo.
texts.en:
José is a young student at SENATI, who lives with his parents and sister in the city of Lima. His parents work sporadically at a factory, which does not allow them to have a fixed monthly income to be able to pay the school costs for their two children. 

José is currently studying industrial electronics and is in his 3rd term of the program. Previously, he also worked but in a very sporadic way doing filing, but due to his school and his work schedules, he had to stop working to be able to continue with his studies. For this reason, he is looking for KIVA's support to be able to finish his studies without any problems. 

Without the support of KIVA, José would have to drop out of his program, since he would focus on working to be able to save up enough money to allow him to finish the program. 

José is very thankful for the support that KIVA offers through IPFE through the education loans, since it is an admirable action because it allows young people like him to achieve their dreams to be excellent professionals. Jose's message is that there are many opportunities to finish schooling, one just needs to have interest and patience to get them.

loans.use: to continue studying his degree in industrial electronics at SENATI and be an excellent professional.

loans.name: Marivis Gabriela

texts.es: Marivis, inició su negocio de venta de productos de marroquinería y ropa en el año 2011; ella deseaba tener ingresos adicionales y un familiar que se encuentra en el vecino país de Venezuela,  le envía los artículos para la venta.  En la actualidad comercializa calzado, bolsos, billeteras, ropa para dama y caballero y sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo, amigos y familiares, a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago.  Sus compras las realiza de contado, y como requiere tener una mayor capacidad de inversión, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará calzado, bolsos, billeteras, ropa para dama y caballero, con la finalidad de renovar y mejorar el surtido para que los clientes se motiven a realizar compras, pues se acercan las fiestas decembrinas y aumenta la demanda de estos productos y Marivis debe tener buenos inventarios para responder. Ella tiene 24 años y su desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para invertir, sin embargo sus metas van encaminadas a mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una solidez financiera, pues desea tener su casa, terminar sus estudios y tener hijos, y con relación a su negocio su sueño de prosperidad es incrementar sus ventas y tener una cartera con más número de clientes.
texts.en:
Marivis started her business of selling leather goods and clothing in 2011. She wanted to have additional income, and a relative in the neighboring country of Venezuela sends her the items to sell. She currently sells footwear, bags, wallets, and clothing for women and men. Her main customers are her coworkers, friends, and relatives, to whom she provides payment plans.

She carries out her purchases in cash and, as such, she needs greater capacity to invest. She is currently applying for a credikiva, her first funding with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy footwear, bags, wallets, and clothing for women and men with the objective to renew and improve her supply so that customers are motivated to make purchases, since the December festivities are approaching and the demand for these products increases and Marivis must have good inventory in order to respond. 

She is 24 years old and her challenge is not having the sufficient working capital to invest. However, her goals are directed at improving her quality of life and having financial strength since she wants to have a home, finish her studies, and have children. In regard to her business, her dream of prosperity is to increase her sales and have a greater list of customers.

loans.use: to buy footwear, bags, wallets, and clothing for women and men.

loans.name: Tercer Cielo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Tercer Cielo lo conforman tres socios laboriosos que por primera vez solicitan el financiamiento a la institución para sus negocios. El coordinado por Linda una joven de 21 años, acompañada, que lucha cada día por el bienestar de su familia, se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas comercializándolas en la capital, occidente del país y en la municipalidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de mango. El resto del grupo lo integran la señora Modesta de 57 años de edad, comerciante de productos químicos en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace treinta años, y William un hombre trabajador de 30 años de edad y dedicado a la comercialización de productos químicos en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace ocho años.
texts.en:
The communal Bank “Tercer Cielo” [Third Heaven] is comprised of three hardworking members who are requesting a loan from the institution for the first time. Linda, 21, is the coordinator. She is in a relationship and fights every day for her family’s well-being. She buys and sells different types of crops in different parts of the country, like the capital, the western region and her hometown.

Linda is requesting a loan to buy mangoes.

The remaining members are Modesta, 57, who has been selling chemical products at the capital’s largest marketplace for thirty years, and William, 30, who is a hardworking man that has also been selling chemical products there for eight years.

loans.use: to buy mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a table top sewing machine and raw materials like fabrics, threads and accessories.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en: Kholoud is a 43-yaer-old married woman who lives in Jarash. Kholoud and her husband are supporting a family of eight members. Her business is poultry farming. She started the business six months ago. Her husband started driving a taxi after his retirement to be able to support the family. She is applying for a loan to increase the number of chickens she has and to warm up the chicken house in preparation for the winter.

loans.use: to increase the number of chickens she has and to warm up the chicken house in preparation for the winter.

loans.name: Osman M.

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Osman M.  He is married, and has 3 children ages 3, 6, and 9 years old, all attending school.  Working days and hours, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business.

Osman M. has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy different sizes of used vehicle tires.  He purchased a piece of land and some house hold items with part of the proceeds from his previous loan.  
 
He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different sizes of used vehicle tires.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Fanta.  She is married, and has three children ages 8, 8, and 5 years old, with two children attending school.  She also has one additional dependent, whom she is fostering.  

In 2009, Fanta established her house hold utensil business, selling sets of pans, dishes, plastic buckets, baskets, glass cups, and spoons.  She was originally introduced to the frozen fish business by her step mother, but when she became independent she made a change to the household utensil business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Fanta would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.  She requires the loan to purchase sets of pans, dishes, and buckets.  In the future, Fanta plans to open a shop and educate her children.  She is a committed and hard working business woman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a set of pans, dishes, and buckets.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married, and has an adult son.  For 23 years she has operated her own women's outerwear business, selling clothing made in Kharkiv, Ukraine.  She has her own trading place, and is a hard working and friendly person.  

Ludmila wants to increase her assortment of outerwear and attract new clients. She is asking for a loan of 40 000 UAH to buy women's clothing for the winter season, including fur coats and overcoats.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a basket of dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for iron rods, roofing nails and paints

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Hawanatu.  She is married and has one child who is 19 years old. In 2010, Hawanatu established her grocery shop. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in their family affairs. Her business is located on the outskirts and her customers are all classes of people. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business

She would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Hawanatu requires a loan in order to buy five cartons of milk, three cartons of batteries, four cartons of soap, sweets, etc. to increase her stock and get more profit.  She was unable to meet all her plans of expanding her business and building a house based on the current situation in the country, but she is still planning to do so if the epidemic becomes a thing of the past. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: DOPE est une veuve avec un enfant en sa charge ; mais elle est âgée de 54 ans et vend de la bouillie préparée à base du maïs depuis 1989, par conséquent s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé « Assiyéyé ».DOPE vend devant son domicile, et souhaite un crédit pour stocker le maïs qui l’aidera à ne pas tomber en rupture de stock afin de satisfaire ses clients et si possible faire des beignets qui pourront accompagner sa vente ;donc ses bénéfices lui serviront à faire face aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Dope is a widow with only one child.  She is 54 years old and has been selling porridge made from maize since 1989.  She buys her supplies twice a month from the Assiyéyé market in Adidogomé.  She sells her porridge from the front of her house.

Dope has requested this loan in order to buy enough maize so she doesn't risk running out of stock.  This will ensure she has enough porridge to meet the needs of her customers.  If possible she would also like to be able to make fritters for sale.

Her profits will be used to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of maize and 7 bowls of sugar for her porridge business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married. She has two adult children. She has her own business.

Angela has a little cafe in her hometown. She has been working in this business for 11 years. Angela's cafe is located near the city center. It is a popular place with tasty food and good service.

Angela is asking for a loan of 35,000 UAH to make repairs in her cafe. She needs to install a heating system and electricity.

loans.use: to make repairs in the cafe

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married. She has two children. She is a good farmer.

Galina grows fruit trees and grapes. Also she has 40 pigs to take care of. Galina is a hardworking and responsible person. She wants to develop her business further and get a bigger income.

Galina is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to buy tree and grape seedlings. Also she wants to buy some fertilizers and chemicals for her garden.

loans.use: to buy tree and grape seedlings, fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en: This is 39 year-old Idrissa.  He is married and has four children ages 12, 8, 6 and 1 years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him assisting him with his business.  In 1997, Idrissa established his used clothing business. He began his business after the death of his parents. Nobody helped him to continue his education, so he ended up doing this business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Idrissa has already received and successfully repaid nine loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of used clothing. In the future, Idrissa plans to expand his business to a larger scale, to complete his house work and to educate his children.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Papa Jeannette

texts.fr: Etant, une femme veuve avec en charge six enfants, JEANNETE vit au quartier Zanguéra et est âgée de 53 ans. Elle prépare et vend la boisson locale faite à base du mil, commerce qu’elle a entamé depuis 1982, puis s’approvisionne une fois seulement par mois au marché de la localité ; ses charges sont très énormes puisque c’est elle seule qui prend soins de ses enfants. Ainsi, afin de se soulager de ses charges par le biais de son activité, JEANNETE sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son approvisionnement et attirer plus de clients pour gagner plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Jeannete is a 53-year-old widow supporting six children, living in the Zanguéra area. She prepares and sells a local drink made from millet.

She started her business in 1982 and resupplies only once a month at the local market. Her expenses are enormous since she is the only one taking care of her children.

To meet her expenses through her business activity, Jeannete is requesting a loan to increase her supplies, so she can attract more clients and make more profits.

loans.use: buy 72 bowls of millet

loans.name: Mawulé  Akossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 25 ans, MAWULE est célibataire sans enfant qui habite au quartier Sagbado situé à la périphérie d’Adidogomé. Elle vend des pagnes depuis 2013, et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé ; et pour vendre elle se promène de quartier en quartier afin de toucher le maximum de clients. MAWULE désire un prêt pour augmenter son stock afin de mieux vendre, étant donné qu’il y a diverses sortes de pagnes ;ce qui pourra l’aider à mieux faire de bénéfices pour améliorer son quotidien et un jour loger dans sa propre maison si possible.
texts.en:
Mawulé is 25 years old, single with no children.  She lives in the Sagbado district, on the outskirts of Adidogomé.  She has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) since 2013, and buys her supplies from the main market in Lomé.

To reach the maximum number of customers, Mawulé carries her pagnes from district to district.  She has requested this loan in order to increase her stock and offer her customers a better choice from the many differents types of pagnes available.  This will improve her profits and, therefore, her standard of living.  She hopes, one day, to be able to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy 8 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Keporé Group

texts.fr: Mariam est le membre représentatif de groupe de 5 femmes, elle est mariée et son marie est chauffeur. Cette brave dame est dans le domaine de la transformation car à base de l'arachide, elle fait de la patte d’arachide. Ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter de l'arachide, décortiquer, faire frire et enfin faire écraser pour obtenir de la patte. Beaucoup de ménage utilise la patte d’arachide pour préparer la sauce pour manger avec du riz au Burkina. Les bénéfices lui permettront d'augmenter la quantité d'arachide.
texts.en:
Mariam is the featured member of this group of five women. She is married and her husband is a driver. This fine lady is active in food preparation as she makes groundnut paste from groundnuts.

This loan will enable her to buy groundnuts, then shell, fry and finally crush them to obtain a paste. Many households in Burkina Faso use groundnut paste to make a sauce eaten with rice.

Profits will enable her to increase the quantity of groundnuts processed.

loans.use: buy groundnuts to prepare groundnut paste for sale

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: SOLANGE fait le commerce d’alimentation générale depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé « Assiyéyé » par manque de moyen financier. Elle est une jeune dame mariée et mère de quatre enfants, puis habite au quartier Sagbado avec sa famille, et est âgée de 39 ans. SOLANGE sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock, répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, mieux économisé afin de pouvoir aider son mari dans les dépenses de leur foyer et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Solange has been selling food since 2005.  However, she can only afford to buy her supplies twice a month from the Assiyéyé market in Adidogomé, as she has insufficient funds.  She is a young, married woman with four children.  She is 39 years old, and she lives with her family in the Sagbado district.

Solange has requested this micro-loan in order to increase her stock levels to meet the demands of her customers.  As this will improve her earnings, she will be able to help her husband to provide for the expenses of their household and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of macaroni, a drum of oil and 3 sacks of rice for her food business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 55-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has two children who are 20 and 28 years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her and receive help with their schooling.  In 2003, Fatmata established her local foodstuffs business selling mainly palm oil and garri. She began her business just to assist her husband in developing their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more palm oil and garri for her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business by building a big store at the centre of the town and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and garri for her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is single and has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Jennifer requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Jennifer has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lolita is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Lolita has a fertilized duck embryo vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional trays of fertilized duck embryos to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of fertilized duck embryo to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 64 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Leticia has a gold fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her fish.

Leticia has been in this business for seven years. Leticia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her fish

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She has been in this business for six years now.

Lolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, puis âgée de 28 ans, CATHERINE est commerçante des produits plastiques depuis 2012 ; elle habite le quartier Zanguéra et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé situé à plus de 30km de son domicile. CATHERINE, cette jeune dame si dynamique, demande un crédit pour soutenir son commerce et augmenter son stock afin de répondre aux besoins si croissantes de sa clientèle, et par conséquent gagner plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Catherine is 28 years old, married and mother to two children.  She has been selling plastic products since 2012.  She lives in the Zanguéra district and buys her stock twice a month from the main market in Lomé, which is more than 30 kilometres from her home.

Catherine is a very dynamic young woman, she has requested this loan to support her business by improving her stock levels.  She will, therefore, be able to respond to her customer's growing demands better.  This will lead to greater profits.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen cooking pots, 2 dozen basins and 2 dozen plastic barrels for resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Maribel has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, meat, etc. for her food production business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maribel has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, spices, fish, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Andres Erasmo

texts.es: Don Andrés, tiene 58 años de edad, soltero, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, vive solo junto a un hermano en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Por mucho tiempo se dedicó a realizar trabajos agrícolas y por necesidad de obtener más ingresos para el hogar, decidió establecer una pulpería en este negocio vende granos básicos, huevos, lácteos, harina, papel higiénico, condimentos, productos enlatados, pastas, refrescos, etc. el negocio tiene cinco años de funcionar y cuenta con buena clientela. Esta solicitando el tercer ciclo de préstamo el cual es por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar mas productos para vender en su negocio, comprará granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, manteca, huevos, harina, productos de limpieza y otros, con el fin de aumentar las ventas y poderle dar mejor servicio al cliente. Su meta es seguir creciendo hasta convertir su negocio en un minisúper para ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en: Andrés is 58 years old, married and has two adult children. He lives with a brother in the town of Azacualpa, in Santa Bárbara.  For a long time, he made a living doing farming work but, because he needed to earn more income to support his household, decided to start a grocery store. There he sells basic grains, eggs, dairy products, flour, toilet roll, condiments, tinned goods, pastas, drinks, and more. The business has been going for five years and he has good customers. Andrés is applying for the third loan cycle, for 25,000 Lempira. With this loan he will stock up his business with food products such as basic grains, meats, softdrinks, lard, eggs, flour, plus cleaning and other products, so as to increase his sales. Andrés' goal is to continue growing to become a mini-supermarket in order to help his family financially.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meats, softdrinks, lard, eggs, flour, cleaning products and other items to sell.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: AMIVI est restauratrice du riz et du haricot depuis l’année 2000 devant une école privée située au côté ouest du quartier Zanguéra où elle habite ;elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants, âgée de 34 ans. AMIVI s’approvisionne une fois par mois par manque de moyen au marché de Zanguéra situé à trois kilomètres de son domicile ; de ce fait elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son approvisionnement en vue de satisfaire sa clientèle ; ce qui pourra l’aider à payer les frais scolaires et faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amivi has been selling rice and beans since 2000, from in front of a private school on the west side of Zanguéra district, where she lives.  She is 4 years old, married and has three children.

Due to lack of funds, Amivi can only buy supplies once a month from the Zanguéra market which is three kilometres from her home.  This is why she has requested a loan.  She will be able to increase her stock levels and satisfy her customers.  This will allow her to pay for her children's school fees and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 44 bowls of beans for her food business.

loans.name: Alodjranoudo

texts.fr: Revendeuse d’huile de palme communément appelé huile rouge depuis 1990, ALODZRANOUDO est veuve et a une personne en sa charge ; au fait, elle loge au quartier Adidogomé puis est âgée de 57 ans, elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois depuis Kpalimé, une ville située à plus de 200km de Lomé. Dans le souci de  subvenir à ses besoins et de mieux se soigner, et en plus mieux épargner, ALODZRANOUDO sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser ses projets.
texts.en:
Alodzranoudo has been selling palm oil (known locally as red oil) since 1990.  She is 57 years old, a widow and responsible for one other person.  She lives in the Adidogomé district.

Twice a month, she buys her supplies from Kpalimé, a town more than 200 kilometres from Lomé.  Alodzranoudo has requested this loan to increase her earnings so she can take better care of herself and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy 5 drums of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Abdou Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdou Karim est emprunteur dans un des guichets de l’IMCEC, où il a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits. Il est marié et père de famille. Il s’active dans le domaine de l’embouche et cela depuis près de 20 ans. Il est aidé par un neveu qui accepte volontiers de s’occuper des bêtes. Aujourd’hui grâce au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter un veau et de l’aliment pour l’entretenir.
Abdou Karim a des charges car il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne, des factures de sa maison et d’autres petits besoins.
Comme il a une grande famille, son projet sera d’élargir sa maison d’ici un à deux ans pour que tout le monde y soit à l’aise
texts.en:
Abdou Karim is a borrower from the field partner, UIMCEC.  He has already had three loans from them.  He is married and has children.

Abdou Karim has been rearing cattle for nearly twenty years.  His nephew is very happy to take care of the cattle.  Abdou Karim will use his loan to buy a calf and some cattle feed.

Abdou Karim is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his household and all its sundry costs.  As he has a large family, he would like to enlarge his home within the next one or two years, to make everyone more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy cattle to rear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Djakarta motorbike for his transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: María Del Amparo

texts.es: María, en su negocio tiene 39 años de experiencia ofreciendo los servicios de confección de ropa para toda la familia; ella nos cuenta que desde niña le gusto este arte, por eso lo estudió y se dedicó completamente a esa labor.  En su proceso productivo realiza todas las operaciones de la confección: diseño, corte, costura y acabado, finalmente el consumidor se mide la prenda y Maria he hace ajustes en caso de ser necesario, pues las ofrece a la medida del cliente y su producción depende del  número de pedidos generados por ellos;  sus principales compradores son sus vecinos, amigos y referidos del barrio en el que reside en el municipio de Barranquilla, a los cuales ofrece facilidades de pago.  Como sus compras las realiza en almacenes del centro de la ciudad, cancelando de contado a sus proveedores,  la relación recuperación de inversión a plazos y compras de contado de materias primas, no responde a su expectativa de aumentar la producción;  por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un mayor volumen de insumos, como hilos, telas, botones, entre otros, con lo que mejorará su negocio. Maria tiene 61 años de edad y es madre de un hijo de 28 años y dos hijas de 36 y 32 años, ella desea mejorar los ingresos familiares y aunque su gran desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente  Maria siempre ella busca la  manera  de cumplirle  a sus clientela.
texts.en:
María has 39 years' experience in her sewing business and she makes clothing for the entire family.  She says she has always enjoyed sewing since she was a little girl, so that is what she studied and works in fully.  During the production process she engages in all aspects of clothing manufucture: design, cutting, sewing and finishing.  Finally, the customer tries on the product and Maria makes the necessary alternations.  She offers tailor-made clothing and her production volume depends on the number of orders generated by the clients.  Her main buyers are neighbors, friends and referrals from the area where she lives in Barranquilla, to whom she offers easy payment terms.

Since she makes her purchases in shops in the city center and pays in cash, the ratio of deferred investment return to cash purchases of raw material does not meet her expectations for increased production.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through CrediKiva, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  This will allow her to buy larger quantities of supplies such as thread, fabric, buttons, etc. to improve her business.

Maria, 61, is the mother of a 28-year-old son and two daughters, ages 36 and 32.  She wants to improve the family income; and although her greatest challenge is having sufficient working capital, Maria always looks for a way to satisfy the customer.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as thread, fabric, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Angel Mauricio

texts.es: Angel tiene 25 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura,Vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar en la comunidad Pucara pertenece a la ventanilla Nueva Esperanza. Solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para sembrar frejol y maiz, para obtener una producción buena ya que es la única actividad que realiza. Hace las compras en san pablo cada 15 días por que no existe transporte frecuentemente, su sueño es sacar adelante a sus padres ya que estan delicadaos de salud, le gusta hacer deporte en sus tiempos libres y la costumbre de su comunida que es el carmaval.
texts.en:
Angel, 25, works in agriculture.  He lives in San Miguel in the Bolívar Province, in the Pucara Community.  It belongs to the area of Nueva Esperanza.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to plant beans and corn in order to produce a good harvest, since this is his only line of work.

Every two weeks he goes to San Pablo to make his purchases, as transportation is not frequent.  His dream is to support and care for his parents who are in delicate health.  He enjoys sports in his free time and the community carnival celebration.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Narcesa

texts.en:
Narcesa is 52 years old and married with seven children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Narcesa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Narcesa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, biscuits, etc.

In the future, Narcesa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 28 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Neneth has a business selling ready to wear in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Neneth has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Richie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Richie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 30 years old and married with five children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Rowena has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rowena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, cereals, juice, candies, noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cereals, juice, candies, noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc.

Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, cereals, juice, candies, noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Shirley has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business.

Shirley has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, beer, vinegar, coffee, sugar, etc.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Virginita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Virginita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall for her vegetable vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Virginita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Zosima has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Zosima has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosana works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosana is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, yeast, sugar, butter, etc. for her bread production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosana has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, yeast, sugar, butter, etc. for her bread production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves to fatten

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 18 años y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es independiente, trabajadora, paciente, buena madre y responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio y la manufactura realizada por inmigrantes de las etnias del lugar como los ‘Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados de occidente. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura promedio de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Yaneth es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello color castaño largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por el comercio. su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es el horneado de pan tradicional, variedades como; pan de arroz (a base de harina de arroz), Mollete (Es el pan corriente de harina, azúcar granulada y manteca), Pan dulce (se utiliza uvas pasas, huevo, leche y azúcar), Rosca de maíz (a base de maíz), Tortilla (Es la masa de pan, que primeramente se aplana, se espolvorea con azúcar y harina, se dobla lo aplanado y se repite varias veces obteniendo después de cocido una especie de pan de hojaldre), etc. “la panadería es un arte diario que los clientes aprecian por eso tengo clientes diarios y algunos mayoristas…”. Su sueño es tener una panadería conocida y vender por mayor, ella desea realizar una inversión en la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de un horno industrial y harina, manteca por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por fin de año. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yaneth solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial y harina, manteca por mayor.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 40 years old and lives with her partner. She has an 18-year-old son and has a bakery business. She is independent, hard-working, patient and responsible and is a good mother. She works in an area called 'plan 3000', a place which is known for business and manufacturing by immigrants from the ethnic groups from places such as the 'Ayoreos' and miners who have relocated from the West. It has a warm and humid tropical climate with an average temperature of 30 degrees centigrade throughout the year.

Yaneth has a dark complexion and long brown hair and is of short stature. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish for business. She lives with her partner who works in construction and her son who goes to school. They live in their own brick-built house which has drinking water and electricity.

She has a business baking traditional bread, with varieties such as rice bread (made from rice flour), 'Mollete' (the everyday bread of flour, lard and granulated sugar), sweet bread (made using raisins, egg, milk and sugar), corn doughnuts (made from corn), 'Tortilla' (the bread dough is first flattened, sprinkled with sugar and flour, folded over and the process is repeated several times giving a kind of 'puff pastry bread' after baking) etc. "The bakery is a daily skill which the customers value and so I have customers who come every day and some wholesale customers..."

Her dream is to have a well-known bakery and sell wholesale. She wants to invest in expanding her business by buying an industrial oven and buying flour and lard wholesale, so she can supply her customers for the end of year season. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years she has been running this business. This is why Yaneth is asking for a loan to buy an industrial oven and buy flour and lard wholesale.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and buy flour and lard wholesale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 46 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Judith is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut flesh. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lordina

texts.en: Lordina is 48 years old and married with nine children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Lordina has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from furniture making. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand. She has been in this business for 13 years now. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is 58 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Trinidad requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials and tools for the maintenance of her fishing boat. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Trinidad has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Marbileta

texts.en:
Marbileta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marbileta is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Marbileta has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Marbileta requested a 25,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.

Marbileta has been in this business for seven years. Marbileta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en: Ederlina is a married woman aged 43 years, and has four children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts, gasoline, etc. for her motorcycle. She has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Ederlina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, gasoline, etc. for her motorcycle to carry out her transport business.

loans.name: Eveshell

texts.en: Eveshell is 46 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Melfa

texts.en: Melfa works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for many years now. In the future, Melfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sr De Ccoylloryty-Paruro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE CCOYLLORYTY-PARURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paruro, perteneciente a la provincia de Paruro y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gertrudes ella es soltera y tiene 60 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en negocio de ganaderia,la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la despues de  la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SR DE CCOYLLORYTY-PARURO” communal bank. It is located in the district of Paruro, in the province of Paruro and the department of Cuzco.

Gertrudes is a member. She is single, 60 years old and has 3 children. She works in the cattle business. She fattens them and later sells them in different markets. She works from a 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Through this work she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand the cattle selling business. She is asking for the loan to buy a head of cattle.  

She is added on to the group photo as her photo was taken after the meeting. She was absent because of work. 

The other members work selling animals, selling cattle, running a grocery store, and selling food.  

Gertrudes is grateful to those whose are a part of this dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Yawoa  Edzenunye

texts.fr: YAWOA est commerçante des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 1997 dans le quartier de Zanguéra  et s’approvisionne au marché d’Adidogomé « Assiyéyé » une fois par mois par manque de moyen financier ; elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants puis âgée de 42 ans. Dans le souci de mieux variés ses produits de vente, YAWOA demande un microcrédit pour s’approvisionner davantage en vue de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’augmenter à cause de sa bonne manière d’accueillir ; ce qui lui permettra de faire plus de bénéfices pour s’occuper de l’éducation ses enfants et assurer un lendemain meilleur.
texts.en: Yawoa has been selling general foodstuffs in Zanguéra district since 1997. She gets her supplies from Assiyéyé Market in Adidogomé only once per month due to financial constraints. She is a 42-year-old married mother to four children. Yawoa is requesting this loan in order to increase her stock so she can better satisfy an ever-growing customer base who appreciate her warm demeanour. This will allow her to bring in larger profits which will aid her in paying for her children's school fees and giving them a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of rice, three cans of oil and three sacks of maize

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, elabora pulseras artesanales e imágenes en porcelana hace 38 años, su familia siempre se ha dedicado a este negocio, razón por la que la tradicion primó en el aprendizaje de este oficio. La oferta artesanias, las realiza desde su loca, ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar muy transitado por su dedicación al comercio, por lo que sus principales clientes son  visitantes y transeuntes del sector, además de vendedores  que allí se acercan.  Su horario de atención es a partir de las 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. Miguel  efectúa sus ventas de contado y sus compras las realiza en almacenes que están ubicados en este mismo sector también de contado, por eso su producción y oferta son menores que sus expectativas de venta. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual invertirá en la compra de piedras y esculturas de pulseras, para ofrecer nuevos modelos en sus productos y hacer mas atractivo su negocio. Miguel tiene 56 años y tiene 2 hijas de 30 y 28 años. Sus metas a futuro son abrir más locales para ampliar la cobertura y con ello incrementar sus clientes, así poder hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel has been producing artisan bracelets and pictures on porcelain for 38 years. His family has always worked in this business and so following this tradition led him to learn these skills. He sells the handicrafts from his outlet which is situated in the middle of the city of Barranquilla, a place which is very busy due to commerce. His main customers are visitors and passers-by in the area, as well as buyers who visit him there. He works from 8am to 6pm.

Miguel does his sales on a cash basis and also uses cash to make his purchases in the stores which are located in the same area. For this reason the amount he produces and has for sale is lower than the sales he would like. Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan. This is the first loan he is applying to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he will use it to buy stones and carved beads for bracelets, so he can offer new designs in his range and make his business more attractive.

Miguel is 56 years old and has 2 daughters aged 30 and 28. His aims for the future are to open up more sales outlets to increase his coverage and so increase his number of customers, which will enable him to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy stones and carved beads for bracelets.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es una mujer de 37 años, viuda, tiene dos hijas de 11 y 9 años y su negocio es la confección de tejidos de mantas de alpaca.
Ella es independiente, trabajadora, emprendedora, y responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ un sitio caracterizado por conectar a varias zonas de la ciudad mediante el transporte público, desde este lugar se puede conseguir transporte a zonas alejadas de el Alto, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura constante entre 4-12 grados centígrados durante todo el año y a una altura de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Nora es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de su madre con sus dos hijas que estudian en la escuela, su casa cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la confección de mantas de Alpaca y específicamente produce; chompas de alpaca de diferentes diseños, mantas de alpaca de diferentes diseños, cubrecamas de alpaca-llama, y guantes de alpaca. “comencé mi negocio porque una comadre me enseño a tejer, desde ahí tomé la iniciativa y empecé a trabajar sola”. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio; tener un taller grande y con mucho trabajo. Ella desea realizar la refacción de su taller de tejido y comprar lana por mayor para la temporada de fin de año. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nora solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor y para la refacción de su taller.
texts.en:
Nora is a 37 year old woman. She has 2 daughters, aged 11 and 9. Her business is making woven blankets from alpaca wool. She is independent, hardworking, enterprising and responsible. She does her job in the area called ‘Cruce Villa Adela’, and area known for connecting to various parts of the city through public transportation. From there one can get transportation to areas far from El Alto. It has a cold and dry climate with a constant temperature of between 4-12 centigrade all year long and is at 3800 meters above sea level.  

Nora has dark skin, long black hair, and is short of stature. Her native tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish. She lives in her mother's house with her two daughters who are in school. Her house has potable water, electricity and gas. Her business is making alpaca blankets. Specifically, she produces alpaca sweaters in different designs, alpaca blankets in different designs, alpaca-llama bedspreads, and alpaca gloves. “I started my business because a comadre taught me how to weave. That is why I took the initiative and started to work on my own”. Her dream is to expand her business and have a big workshop with a lot of work. She wants to remodel her weaving workshop and buy wool wholesale for the end of the year season. This is her first cycle of loans with the institution in the 2 years that she has been doing this activity. 

That is why Nora is asking for a loan to buy alpaca wool wholesale and to remodel her workshop.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool wholesale and to remodel her workshop.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 46 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Josefina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josefina has been in pig fattening for five years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 52 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Teodora is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Teodora has been in pig fattening for four years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 42 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Divina runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like noodles, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, coffee, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years, and sells a variety of items such as noodles, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, coffee, etc. 

Divina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like noodles, detergent soap, canned goods, snack foods, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Sot is a 50-year-old woman who lives in a remote area of Battambang Province, Cambodia. At home, she is a lovely mother of four children; three are single and one is married. To make a living, she manages and operates a rice farming business on farm land that is located near her house. So far, she has been involved in this business for 14 years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 2.00 per day. 

Sot wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV, and radio. 

She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is 31 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a nipa roofing making business in the Philippines. 

Irish requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Irish has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Sinfrosa

texts.en:
Sinfrosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Sinfrosa has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from tailoring.

Sinfrosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fe is 36 years old, and has two children who are in school. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

Fe has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Losbe

texts.en:
Losbe is 38 years old and has two children. She is married, and her two children are in school.

Losbe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Losbe has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Losbe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Luis Vinicio

texts.es: Luis tiene 22 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura es soltero y vive con sus padres en San Miguel provincia de Bolívar en la comunidad Pucara, pertenece a la ventanilla rural La Nueva Esperanza. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes para empezar a sembrar frejol y para la ompra de pollos para engordarlos y luego venderlos su sueño es obtener una producción buena ya que es la única actividad que realiza.Compra en san pablo cada 15 días  lo necesario las siembras por que no existe transporte frecuentemente, su sueño es sacar adelante a su familia, le gusta hacer deporte en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en:
Luis, 22, earns a living in agriculture.  He's single and lives with his parents in San Miguel, in the province of Bolívar, in the Pucara community.  He belongs to La Nueva Esperanza Community Bank.

Luis is requesting the loan to buy organic soil amendments and fertilizer to start planting beans, and to buy chickens to sell.  He hopes to get a good crop because it's his only job.

He buys what he needs for his crops in San Pablo every two weeks because there's no frequent transportation.

Luis's dream is to get his family ahead.  He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other items for the maintenance of his crops.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 57 years old and married with eight children. Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, coffee, spices, canned goods, seasonings, etc. 

Adelaida requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Adelaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 46 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, coffee, noodles, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, coffee, noodles, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, coffee, noodles, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking mom who always cares for the future of their children. 

Sandra and her husband sell street foods, cold drinks, and other snack foods in different villages, but most of the time they sell in front of schools. Sandra is very proud that, even though vending is their only source of income, she and her husband are able to improve their standard of living. She says that their present business is very important for them to have a stable source of income that serves to meet their daily needs. 

Sandra wishes to expand the business they have now. In this connection, Sandra is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy powder juice, breads, ham, hot dogs, and many more items. 

Sandra and her husband are doing their best to improve their business more and expand it someday through the income they earn.

loans.use: to buy powder juice, breads, ham, hot dogs, and many more items.

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
Leony, 42, is a married woman with six children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Leony has a direct selling Splash products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Leony requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products from Splash to sell to her customers.

In the future, Leony would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia works hard to support her family. 

Leticia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Leticia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Leticia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo grows fruit crops in his field. He uses most of his earnings during harvesting season to sustain their basic necessities, but some are invested in their other crops. 

At present, Danilo’s priority is to send his children to school and to the college level of education. He will do his best to give them a better future. 

Danilo admits that he doesn’t have enough capital for the sustenance of his fruit crop. He is having difficulty providing his crop needs. Thus, he wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizers for his pineapple crops. He wishes to harvest quality fruits that enable him to sell with a good price. 

He will use his earnings in achieving his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his pineapple crops.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. 

Marilyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Marilyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rodelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling jewelry in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from clothing sales.  

Rodelyn is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of jewelry to sell.

Rodelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia patiently runs her vehicle spare parts business in the market. She enjoys managing her business while she is earning profits. Herminia’s goal is to satisfy her customers and give them good service so that they become her regular customers. 

Aside from selling wheels and accessories for motorcycles, Herminia wants to sell more accessories for vehicles like chains, brake kits, deflectors, and seat covers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy accessories like brake kits, seat covers, chains, and deflectors. 

She believes that by selling more accessories she will also raise her income and able to extend her support to her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy accessories like brake kits, seat covers, chains, and deflectors.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old, married, and has eight children.

Norma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Norma requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Norma has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Norma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 64 years old, widowed, and has four children. She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Carmelina is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Carmelina has been farming corn for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is 39 years old and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Ma. Dolores has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Ma. Dolores requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, Ma. Dolores would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 45 years old, married, and has ten children. With four children currently in school, Eufemia works very hard to provide for them.

Eufemia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory like candies, soft drinks, sanitary pads, diapers, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell.

Eufemia has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, soft drinks, sanitary pads, diapers, canned goods, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase candies, soft drinks, sanitary pads, diapers, canned goods, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Exequila

texts.en:
Exequila is a married woman with six children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Exequila is 59 years old.

Exequila has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Exequila has been in this business for 21 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Las calles de Sololá es testigo de los colores más vistosos impregnados en los artículos artesanales.  Es imposible que cualquier turista deje de admirar este producto, pararse y hacer una buena compra de ello. De 52 años de edad casado Miguel es un ejemplo en tener vivo las culturas de  Guatemala, el tiene  siete hijos, los primeros 3 hijos ya tienen familias independientes y los 4 últimos son estudiantes en la escuela cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que el dignamente realiza es tejer artículos artesanal el lo ha venido realizando desde hace mas de 25 años ya que para el es algo que le gusta hacer, para tener un ingreso económico par el sustento de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida par el y su familia, con los ingresos económicos que el obtiene de sus ventas de dicha actividad que realiza mejora los estudios de sus hijos.

El motivo de la realización del préstamo es para la compra de hilos e insumos para artículos artesanales ya que para el son de mucha importancia obtener materia prima para la realización de los artículos artesanales para así obtener recursos económicos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Uno de los sueños de Miguel es la ampliación de su negocio y la realización de más artículos artesanales para poder brindarles un buen servicio a las personas que lo visitan.
texts.en:
