The streets of Sololá are witness to the spectacular colors of handcrafted goods.  It's impossible for tourists not to stop to admire those products and buy something.

Miguel exemplifies the living cultures of Guatemala.  He's 52 years old and married, and he has seven children.  The oldest four already have their own families and the other four attend a school near his community.

The work he does with dignity is weaving handmade articles.  He has done this work for more than 25 years because it's something he likes to do to earn an income to support his family and improve their living conditions.  He improves his children's education with the income from his sales.

The reason for the loan is to buy thread and materials for handcrafted articles.  It's very important for Miguel to get the supplies to do his work so he can earn the income to improve his family's living conditions.

One of Miguel's dreams is to expand his business and make more handcrafted goods to offer good service to the people who visit him.

loans.use: to buy thread and materials for handcrafted articles

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, beads, needles, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Isidra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, beads, needles, etc. for her business

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa ella es casada y tiene 35 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas,asados de carnes, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,arroz, carne y verduras.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "El Triunfo" (Triumph) communal bank; it is located in the Lamay district, belonging to the Calca province in the Cusco department. The partner is Mrs. Tomasa, she is married and 35 years old with three children. 
She makes a living running her restaurant. She makes different dishes such as chicken with potatoes, roasted meats, soups and beef stir fry. She works from 10:00 am to 8:00 pm and has been in this business for 10 year, doing quite well for herself. Her dream is to expand the restaurant. 
She is requesting the loan to purchase cooking ingredients such as chicken, rice, meat and vegetables. 
The other members work in agriculture, animal sales, grocery store and a food business. Mrs. Tomasa thanks those who are part of this dream through this means and she promises to meet her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: purchase cooking ingredients such as chicken, rice, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Geylin Amilcar

texts.es: Este es el tercer crédito que Geylin solicita a la institución ya que los anteriores le han sido de mucha ayuda. Se dedica hace 8 años a la actividad de la siembra de tomate en su comarca. Los créditos anteriores le han sido de mucha ayuda ya que ha logrado comprar abonos, insecticidas así como el pago de la mano de obra para su cosecha, obteniendo de esa manera ganancias para comprar terneros para engorde y desarrollo. Solicita un nuevo crédito para darle manejo agronómico a casi dos manzanas de tomate que tiene cultivada. Esta nueva inversión le generará mayores ganancias y podrá comprar mayor ganado. Dentro de su próxima meta esta cultivar 2 manzanas de tomate.
texts.en:
This is Geylin's third loan from the institution because the previous ones were a lot of help to him.  He was able to buy soil amendments and insecticide as well as pay for labor to harvest his crop; he earned more profits for buying calves to raise and fatten.

Geylin has worked for eight years growing tomatoes in his area.  He's requesting a new loan to take care of the almost two manzanas of tomatoes he's growing.  This new investment will generate more profit for him and he'll be able to buy more livestock.

One of his next goals is to grow two manzanas of tomatoes.

loans.use: to take care of the almost two manzanas of tomatoes he is growing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bales of new clothing like bras, blouses, pants, towels, perfume for women, cologne for men, etc. to meet her demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lorenzo Antonio

texts.es: Lorenzo de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la  crianza de ganado   lechero (producción y venta de leche)  en la zona donde reside, tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio, por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado y ajustar para la compra de un toro que le permita crecer en el negocio para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Lorenzo is 52 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. He makes a living raising dairy cattle (for the production and sales of milk) in the area where he resides. He has a good client base since he was known how to win the confidence of his clients. He offers quality and good prices for his products and has decided to invest in the care of his cattle as his business depends on it. This is why he has requested this loan to be able to purchase vitamins for the cattle and gather enough for the purchase of a bull which will allow him to grow the business to have better incomes.

loans.use: purchase vitamins for the cattle and gather enough for the purchase of a bull.

loans.name: Jessenia Olieth

texts.es: Jessenia es un microempresaria emprendedora de 34 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos uno de cinco años y otro de nueve años, propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace dos año y medio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, gaseosas, jugos, papel de aluminio, servilletas y granos básicos etc. Una de sus metas es pagar puntual las cuotas del préstamo para gozar de los beneficios de tener un buen récord crediticio y le sigan financiando para el crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en: Jessenia is a 34-year-old enterprising micro-entrepeneur. She is in a relationship and is the mother of two children, ages five and nine. Jessenia owns a small grocery store, which she has run from her home for two-and-a-half years. She is requesting a loan to buy toilet paper, sanitary napkins, soda, juice, aluminum foil, napkins, basic grains, etc. One of her goals is to pay her loan installments in a timely manner in order to enjoy the benefits of a good credit record and be able to secure future loans to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, sanitary napkins, soda, juice, aluminum foil, napkins, basic grains, etc. to increase sales.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 51 years old, married, and has six children. She operates a pig fattening business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Juditha requested a loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Heimy Higinia

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para comprar un molino de nixtamal e instalarla en el centro de su comunidad.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. Heimy de 34 años de edad Casada y vive con sus esposo a tomando el reto de la vida no como un obstáculo sino como una oportunidad de poder demostrar a las demás personas de que si se puede superar en la vida.

La actividad que realiza con todo empeño todos los días es trabajar en su casa sirviendo a las personas con su molino de nixtamal, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 15 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de refacciones de la comunidad donde ella vive para poder tener un ingreso extra para apoyar a su familia.

El uso respectivo que dará al crédito gestionado es para la compra de dos molinos de nixtamal ya que ella quiere expandir su negocio por lo cual necesita instalar dos molinos más en su comunidad para tener mejores ingresos económicos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y hijos. Una de las  más grandes aspiraciones de ella es seguir en el negocio del molino de nixtamal y en la construcción de una vivienda digna para vivir.
texts.en:
Life gave her an opportunity to purchase a corn mill and install it in the center of her community. It was what she had been waiting for, not only an open door, but also what lay beyond said door. What she found defined the thing she wanted to be. Heimy is 34 years old, is married and lives with her husband taking on the challenge of life not as an obstacle, but an opportunity to show other people that it is possible to get ahead in life. 

The activity which she performs daily with determination is working in her home, serving people with her corn mill. She has been doing this for 15 years and she also sells refurbished goods of the community where she lives in order to have an extra income to support her family.

She will be using the loan given to purchase two corn mills because she wants to expand her business and this requires that she install two more mills in her community to have better economic incomes in order to improve her family and children's life conditions. One of her biggest aspirations is to continue the corn mill business and build a dignified residence to live in.

loans.use: to buy two corn mills.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Lisandro

texts.es: Lisandro se dedica a la elaboración de productos derivados de la harina de trigo, como deditos, de queso, bocadillo, empanadas etc. Su experiencia data de hace 5 años, cuando un amigo suyo le propuso el negocio, pues estaba seguro de que era bueno. Lisando inició en el año 2009 individualmente, porque en ese año se quedó sin empleo y necesitaba ingresos para sostenerse. Hoy se ha especializado en fabricar manualmente deditos de queso y bocadillo, que vende desde el lugar donde habita  y tambien distribuye en el barrio entre sus vecinos y algunos negocios que lo requieran. Todos los dias trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde, prepara su mesa, organiza sus ingredientes utilizando la harina de trigo como su materia prima, la cual amasa y corta en porciones, agregando los ingredientes para obtener un producto final fresco y delicioso. Sus ventas las realiza de contado; él para producir  de manera efectiva, compra a proveedores y graneros especializados, que ofrecen precios que le permiten competir en el mercado. Su meta mas adelante es tener puntos comerciales diversos y una unidad productiva ínica, que le facilite su crecimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un  credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen harina, bocadillo y queso, aprovechando la temporada decembrina que llega con muchas festividades y es en ese momento en el que se incrementa el consumo de los deliciosos pasabocas.
texts.en:
Lisandro works making products from wheat flour like cheese deditos, guava jelly, empanadas etc. He had 5 years experience when a friend of his started the business as he was sure that it was good. Lisandro started in the year 2009 on his own as in this year he became unemployed and needed income to support himself.

Today he specializes in making cheese deditos (little fingers) and guava jelly which he sells from his place of residence. He also distributes them in the neighborhood to neighbors and a few businesses that request them. He works from 8 in the morning every day until 6 in the evening. He prepares his dough, organizes this ingredients using the wheat flour as his main ingredient which he kneads and cuts in portions. He adds ingredients to get his final fresh and delicious product. He makes his sales in cash. To make his production in an efficient manner he buys from providers and specialized grain dealers who offer him prices that allow him to compete in the market.

His goal for the future is to have a variety of points of sale and a single productive unit which will facilitate his growth. Currently he is requesting a loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with which he will buy a greater volume of flour, guava jelly and cheese taking advantage of the December season which comes with it's many festivals. At this time the consumption of his delicious treats increases.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, guava jelly and cheese.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de donas y empanadas u negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar y tiene muchos clientes por las calidad con que elabora los alimentos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de harina, leche, azúcar y demas ingredientes para continuar con la elaboración de los alimentos y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. For many years she has worked making and selling donuts and empanadas. She runs her business from home and she has many customers because of the quality of her meals. 

Virginia is requesting a loan to buy flour, milk, sugar and other ingredients to continue making her meals and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLLILAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina ella es conviviente y tiene 40 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The group members belong to the "Los Comerciantes de Andahuayllilas" [Andahuayllilas Merchants] communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Andahuayllilas, in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cuzco. The featured member is Valentina. Valentina lives with her partner, is 40 years old, and has three children. She has a cattle business: she fattens and raises cattle that she later sells in various markets. Valentina works from 8am until 6pm. She hopes to get ahead through this work and dreams to expand her cattle sales. She is requesting a loan to buy cattle. Her photograph has been inserted into the group photo, as she requested it be taken at a later time for work reasons. The other group members work selling chicha [a sweet drink made from purple corn], animal husbandry, grocery store sales, and food sales. Valentina would like to thank those who contribute to her dream through this platform and is committed to pay her loan installments within the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 48-year-old married woman with five children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Leonora has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 13 years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Sonia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene la edad de 35 años, acompañada y madre de un joven de 13 años quien es su deseo de superación para seguir adelante. Es propietaria de una tienda de zapatos desde hace cuatro años y el crédito lo solicita para invertir en su negocio como zapatos para niños y niñas, sandalias, zapatos deportivos de manera que se logre satisfacer su demanda e incrementar las ventas.
texts.en: Sonia is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is 35 years old, in a relationship, and the mother of a 13-year-old boy, who is her motivation for getting ahead. She has owned a shoe store for four years and is requesting a loan to invest in her business by buying children's shoes, sandals, and athletic shoes in order to satisfy demand and increase sales.

loans.use: buy children's shoes, sandals, and athletic shoes in order to satisfy demand.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina works hard to support her family. Ludivina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ludivina requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Ludivina has been in this business for 16 years now.

Ludivina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Sara Débora

texts.es:
Guatemala es reconocido por su gente trabajadora con el deseo de superación en la vida que toma las cosas como un reto en la vida para poder llegar a realizar grandes logros es el caso de Sara que se a tenido que ingeniar en como tener un ingreso económico par su familia ella apenas tiene 22 años de edad soltera y vive con sus padres y con el deseo de superar cada día.

El trabajo que ella realiza en su comunidad donde ella vive es la compraventa y producción de productos artesanales ya que genera una ganancia económica para el sustento de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de refacciones en su comunidad apoyando a las personas que requieren de sus servicios pues es lo hace para tener un ingreso extra del trabajo que realiza.

El uso respectivo que ella dará al préstamo que está realizando es para la compra de productos y artículos  artesanales para luego venderlas en su comunidad y en todos sus alrededores, las metas de Sara en la vida es la construcción de su casa para que ella y su familia tengan una condición de vida adecuada en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Guatemala is known for it's hard-working people who have the desire to succeed in life and take things as a challenge in their lives to be able to make great achievements. This is the case of Sara who had to come up with how to have an economic income for her family. She is 22 years old, single and lives with her family and with the desire to succeed each day.

The work that she does in the community where she lives is buying, selling and production of handicraft products. It generates an economic income to support her family and improve their living conditions. Her second business is selling spare parts in her community supporting the people who require her services. This gives her a second income from the work she does. She will use the loan to purchase products and items of handicraft to later sell in her community and the surroundings. Sara's goals are to build a house for her and her family so that they have adequate living conditions in the not too distant future.

loans.use: to buy handicraft products and items.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is 58 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Medina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Medina has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. Myrna is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 12 years now.

Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Noemy Esmeralda

texts.es: Noemy vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Noemy está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara salvasol que es una lámpara de carga con energía de paneles solares, dirigida principalmente a hogares del área rural que carecen de conexión de energía eléctrica, por esa razón está solicitando el crédito para comprar dicha lámpara y así poder vivir mas cómodos con su familia.
texts.en: Noemy lives in her own house with her family. She is an employee of a private business and she manages to cover some of her household expenses with her earnings. Noemy is requesting a loan to buy a SolvaSol lamp, which is a solar-powered lamp designed for rural homes that are not connected to the electrical grid, for her family's comfort.

loans.use: buy a SalvaSol [solar-powered] lamp.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Neneth has been in this business for seven years. Neneth earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Neneth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sherley

texts.en:
Sherley is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sherley is 46 years old, and two children are currently in school.

Sherley has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Sherley requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food-production business.

Sherley has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Sherley would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Nasirudin

texts.en:
This is the story of Hasanah, daughter of Nasirudin: 

"I was the second child of four siblings. My father is Nasirudin and my mother is Rowiyah. My father has a laborer job. My parent's monthly income is 500,000 per month, whereas the (other) sisters are still in junior high school and elementary.

"I feel lucky to have chosen the vocational school in Jos Soedarso Sidareja that (has) cooperation with Kiva, so the program will be very helpful to me in particular, and students whose parents have a weak economy in general. 

Thanks for all."

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Angela Veronica

texts.es: Angela de 33 años de edad tiene un puesto de venta de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace vario años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella quiere comprar mas materia prima como: arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Angela is 33 years old and has a food stall that she has managed for several years near her place of residence. With the income she earns from her sales, she is able to pay for household expenses. Angela lives in her own home along with her husband and two children.

She wants to buy more supplies such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, and other items so that she can vary her menu and have a bit more financial footing. However, she does not have sufficient resources to make this investment. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy these supplies and generate more earnings in order to have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing. Ma. Liza is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle transport business.

Ma. Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy young bulls for the milling of sugarcane.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 58 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Evangeline has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Evangeline has been in this business for two years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mercy is 41 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Mercy has a electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. Mercy requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional  electronic mobile load to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mercy has been in this business for six years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional electronic mobile load to sell

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère d’un seul enfant, ADZOVI est une jeune dame âgée de 28 ans. Elle habite au quartier Adidogomé et vend des produits de mercerie dans sa petite boutique depuis 2013, puis s’approvisionne au moins deux fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour ce faire, ADZOVI désire un prêt pour consolider son commerce, diversifier ses produits pour plus attirer de clients dans le but de mieux tirer de bénéfices pour aider son marie face aux diverses dépenses de leur foyer et améliorer sa vie.
texts.en: Married and the mother of one child, Adzovi is a 28-year old woman. She lives in the Adidogomé district and sells sewing supplies in her small shop. She stocks up at least twice a month at the big market in Lomé. And thus Adzovi would like to receive a loan to strengthen her business, diversify her merchandise and attract more customers  in order to increase her earnings and help her husband with meeting the household expenses and improve her family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to buy two rolls of Vlieseline interfacing textile and six rolls of lining.

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Andrea, la socia tiene 68 años de edad es viuda y tiene 08 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, aceite entre otros. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

Las personas mayores de 65 años de edad  están excluidas del sistema financiero formal y gracias a los inversionistas de Kiva pueden lograr su financiamiento de tal manera la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Emprendamos El Futuro” which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Andrea is 68 years old, widowed, and has eight children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery business. Andrea sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, snack foods, and other items. She has been devoted to her business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. Andrea wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy milk, oil, and other items.

The other members engage in businesses such as managing a bookstore, selling clothes, managing a grocery store, and operating a restaurant. The person in the photo whose face is covered is not a member of the Communal Bank.

Older people who are 65 and up are excluded from the formal financial system. Thanks to Kiva lenders, they are able to secure funding. For this reason, Andrea promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy milk, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 43 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 4 school age children. He has a hectare of a calamansi orchard and during the harvest he delivers them to his customers. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan to pay for labor and maintenance of his calamansi orchard to have more fruit and sustain the needs of his family. He has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. 

In the future, Rogelio wants to secure that his children have their own stable job.

loans.use: to pay for labor and maintenance of his calamansi orchard

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 46 years old, married and has seven children, four who are currently in school.

Artemia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Artemia has been farming vegetables for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Artemia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sapar

texts.ru:
Сапар  очень трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 57 лет. У Сапара  средне- техническое образование. Он  имеют троих детей. Жена Сапара не имеет высшего образования и является домохозяйкой. Смотрит за огромным хозяйством и воспитывает троих детей. 
Сапара занимается своим бизнесом. У него  крупно рогатый скот. Он ухаживает за ним. Жена так же помогает Сапару. Она продает соседям  молоко, полученным от скота. От данного дела они имеют хороший доход. Сейчас Сапар хочет получить кредит, чтобы увеличить численность скота. Сапар заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется положительный результат
texts.en:
Sapar is a very hard working man , 57 years of age. Sapar has finished a technical college. He has three children. Sapar’s wife did not go to college. She is a homemaker who has raised three children and is taking care of a large household.

Sapar has his own business. He raises cattle. Sapar’s wife also helps him. She sells milk in the neighborhood. Sapar and his wife receive a decent income from this business. At present Sapar would like to take out a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. Sapar thanks Arvand for support in advance and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 65 years old and married with three children.  

Dominga is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle. Dominga has been raising cattle for 8 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dominga would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es de Ciudad del Este, está estudiando la carrera de Periodismo, comenta que es su familia quien la inspira a poder seguir sus metas y objetivos.
Se define a si misma como una persona responsable y luchadora, que se esfuerza por un objetivo, el cual es ser un profesional útil, no solo a si mismo, sino también a los demás.
Pide este préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le permitirá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Ana is from Ciudad del Este. She is studying for a degree in Journalism. Ana says that her family inspires her to continue pursuing her goals and objectives.

Ana defines herself as a responsible and determined individual. She strives to reach her goal of becoming a useful professional, not only for herself, but also to help others.

Ana is requesting this loan in order to pay for her degree fees, which will allow her to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Esperanza De Los Angeles

texts.es: Esperanza es una mujer emprendedora y tiene la edad de 54 años, madre de dos hijos uno de 16 años y el otro de 21 años quienes son su deseo de superación para salir adelante, se dedica a la venta de frutas, tajadas con queso y solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas de la temporada como naranjas, pitayas, bananos, mamón chino, queso al por mayor, plátanos, utensilios de cocina, etc. Ella lleva siete ciclos trabajando con la institución ADIM y ha sabido aprovechar el financiamiento otorgado para el crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en: Esperanza is an enterprising woman who is 54 years old and a mother to two children who are 16 and 21 years old. They are her reason to keep going and create a better future. Esperanza sells fruit and fried plantains with cheese. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruit such as oranges, pitayas, bananas, rambutans, cheese in bulk, plantains, kitchen utensils, etc. Esperanza has spent seven loan cycles working with ADIM and she knows how to take advantage of the loan which has been granted to her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit such as oranges, pitayas, bananas, rambutans, cheese in bulk, plantains, kitchen utensils, etc. to satisfy customer demand

loans.name: Ramon Alberto

texts.es: Ramon de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el tiene una barbaría ubicada en su lugar de residencia, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y colocando puertas y ventanas, pero con lo que el gana no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, polines, puertas, balcones, vidrios para ventanas y pago de mano de obra para que el y su esposa puedan vivir mas seguros
texts.en:
Ramon, 30 years of age, lives in his own house with his wife. He has a barber shop located in his place of residence. Ramon wishes to improve his house, replacing the roof and hanging doors and windows. But what he earns is insufficient to pay for the job. 

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase metal sheeting, rafters, doors, balconies and window glass, plus funds to pay the workers, so that he and his wife can live more securely.

loans.use: buy metal sheeting, rafters, doors, balconies, and window glass, plus paying the workers' wages.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Phary

texts.en:
Phary is 24 years old, single and lives with her family at Chba Ampov district ,Phnom Penh. She has been a student and  English teacher for a private training centre for 2 years.

Sovan is in her 4th years of a bachelor degree at Build Bright University.  Her major is banking . She will graduate in July 1, 2015.  She would like to apply for a loan for pay her school fee.

Her current helps her to earn some money for living expenses.

 She hopes that she will become a professional accountant in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her tutor fees.

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora carla es habitante de chinandega  cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida desde hace 20 años es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por sacar adelante a su hija que estudia en la universidad  la señora solicita el financiamiento cada 2 meses para la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, aceite y verduras para realizar la elaboracion de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Sra. Carla is a resident of Chinandega. She has a business where she has been selling food for the past 20 years. Carla is a hardworking woman who strives to get ahead on behalf of her daughter who is studying at the university.

She is requesting a loan. Every two months, Carla buys supplies such as rice, beans, oil, and vegetables so that she can prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from the time she was a child, tending the crops and harvesting, and earning income as well. Mary Jane has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Mary Jane has nurtured her membership with PMPC, and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she could turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds, which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yield seedlings.  Someday, Mary Jane hopes to purchase more land to cultivate rice that will potentially add income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yield seedlings

loans.name: Grecilda

texts.en:
Grecilda is 34 years old and married with three children, one attends school.  Grecilda works very hard to provide for them.

Grecilda has run a general store for 5 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, detergent, sanitary pads, milk, and juice. 

Grecilda would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es: Adalberto de 63 años de edad,  nació en  un municipio del departamento de Bolívar, de donde hace 32 años adquirió su experiencia personal como panadero, aunque desde muy pequeño, hace 50 años, estuvo muy cerca a esta actividad, pues fue tradicional entre sus padres y otros familiares.  Como padre de 4 hijos, hoy adultos, debió responder a la obligación de su hogar en compañía de su cónyuge, con un negocio de la panadería que le ofreciera la oportunidad de generar ingresos para sostener su hogar;  hoy cónyuge, uno de sus hijos y él,  forman parte del equipo de trabajo de su panadería. Su mercado de clientes son principalmente las tiendas de los alrededores y vecinos de su barrio, a quienes vende de contado, produciendo de lunes a sábados, en un horario que inicia desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mari Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, materias primas como harina, e insumos como azúcar, grasas, lácteos etc, con los cuales incrementará su producción de pan de queso y panes de mantequilla, líneas de productos que rotan fácilmente y generan mayores e inmediatas utilidades, por su alto consumo. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local, punto comercial donde ofrecer sus productos  que fidelice aún más a su clientela.
texts.en:
Adalberto is 63 years of age. He was born in a municipality in Bolivar department where, some 32 years ago, he acquired personal experience as a baker. Although he was very young, roughly 50 years ago, he was very close to this activity which was a tradition among his parents and other family members.

As the father of four children, all adults today, Adalberto had to respond to the obligations of his household, together with his wife, by opening a bakery that could offer the opportunity to generate income to sustain his household. Today, his wife, one of his children and he himself make up his bakery's work team.

Adalberto's clientele are composed, principally, of the stores around him, and neighbors of his barrio, to whom he sells for cash, producing from Mondays to Saturdays, working from 6:00 am until 7:00 pm.

Adalberto is now applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to purchase primary materials like flour and inputs such as sugar, lard, milk products, etc. With these, he will increase production of cheese and butter breads, lines of production that move easily, generating larger and immediate profits due to their high consumption. 

Adalberto's goal further along is to have a shop, a commercial point where he could offer more products that would please his customers even more.

loans.use: buy primary products such as flour, and inputs like sugar, lard, milk products, etc., for his bakery.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар молодая жительница района Яван. Ей 22 года. Она рано вышла замуж и родила дочку, котороой сейчас 6 лет и сына, которому 2 годика. Ее муж предоставляет услуги такси, а также занимается животноводством. Сама Нилуфар домохозяйка и нигде в данный момент не работает. Однако Нилуфар научилась кройке и шитью и теперь хотела бы начать собственное дело в этом направлении. Нилуфар просит кредит, чтобы купить себе модернизированную швейную машинку и работать на дому. Она планирует брать заказ на пошив женских национальных платьев. Благодаря кредиту у нее будет наконец работа и она будет независимой женщиной и приносить доход в семью.
texts.en: Nilufar is a young resident of the Yavan district. She is 22 years old. She got married early and gave birth to a daughter, who is now 6 years old, and a son, who is 2 years old. Her husband provides taxi services and is also involved in animal husbandry. Nilufar is a homemaker and is currently not employed anywhere. However, Nilufar learned how to cut and sew, and now wants to start her own business in this field. Nilufar is requesting a loan to purchase a modern sewing machine and work at home. She plans to fulfill orders to sew women's national dresses. Thanks to this loan, she will finally have work, she can become an independent woman and bring income into the family.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine in order to start her own sewing business

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 59 years old, married, and has three adult children. She lives in Dumingag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She makes delicious "puto" (steamed rice) for house to house selling, which she has been doing for three years.

Dominga requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to buy ingredients to make more "puto" to sell.  This loan will help increase sales and provide for the needs of her family. In the future, she wants to purchase an electric mixer for her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make "puto" (steamed rice)

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta is an enthusiastic  farmer. She has grown corn in Mahayag and earns well doing this type of work. 

She applied a loan to pay for land and preparations to ensure that the field is ready for planting. Floreta wants to do things right and earn more income for this growing season.

 In the future, Floreta hopes to buy a truck to transport her produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and cultivation.

loans.name: Rosa Anabel

texts.es: Rosa de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para continuar con su trabajo
texts.en:
Rosa, 34 years old, lives in her own home with her family group.  For the past five years she has made a living selling tortillas. Her business is run from her residence and she has many customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase corn by the hundredweight and lime so that she can continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn by the hundredweight and lime.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 49-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as coffee, cereal, chocolate drinks, soft-drinks, noodles, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 4 years, and sells a variety of items. 

Gemma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as coffee, cereal, chocolate drinks, soft-drinks, noodles, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet in her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 53 years old and married. 

Juliet has raised pigs for 15 years and requests 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 21 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Juliet would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a motorcycle transportation business for 10 years. 

She is borrowing 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools to maintain her motorcycle.

Lilia earns additional income raising pigs.

Lilia has sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wants to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools to maintain  her motorcycle.

loans.name: Markara

texts.en:
Markara (in the photo) is 29 years old, and he lives in the Dong Kor district in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Married since 2005, he has one son and two daughters.

Markara is a master builder with nine years' experience, while his wife has been a farmer for many years.

Now he would like to apply for a loan to repair his house, because his house is so old.  He hopes that he will get a better house after the repairs.

loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru: Марчона молодая жительница из городка Турсунзаде. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. Марчона живет вместе с родителями и братьями. У нее большая семья. Марчона несмотря на свой юный возраст, уже многое знает о видении сельского хозяйства. Все сельские жители занимаются посевом зимнего урожая, и Марчона тоже не отстает от них. Марчона готовится посеять зимнюю пшеницу. Ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, для приобретения пшеницы и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Поддержите юную Марчону в ее планах.
texts.en: Marjona is a young resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 21 years old and not married. Marjona lives with her parents and brothers. She has a big family. Despite her young age, Marjona already knows a lot about running an agricultural business. All of the rural residents are involved in sewing the winter crop, and Marjona is not falling behind. Marjona is getting ready to sew winter wheat. She is short a small amount of money to buy wheat, and she decided to request a loan. Please support young Marjona in her plans.

loans.use: to buy wheat in order plant the winter crop

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net (shown in the photo) is 34 years old and lives in the Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. Net has been married since 2002 and has two sons and two daughters. They are attending in school.

Net has worked as a cleaner at Koh Pich city in Phnom Penh for two years, while her husband is a master builder with 10 years' experience. 

Now she would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorbike to take to her work place.

Though she is a cleaner, she can earn money to pay back the loan and can save some money to support her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her work.

loans.name: James Winston

texts.en:
James Winston is a 25-year-old resident of Zaragoza, Nueva Ecija. 

At his age, he knows that he should be helping his parents and siblings. To make this possible, he will be taking up a "mechatronics" course so he can have a stable job in the near future. He chose this course because these skills are in demand. 

To help him sustain his studies, he is requesting an education loan of PHP15,000 from the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Melani

texts.en:
Melani is a live-in partner woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melani is 25 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Melani has a food vending business in the Philippines. Melani requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Melani has been in this business for aix years. In the future, Melani would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Loida is 37 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Loida has a repair shop business in the Philippines. Loida requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional tools and equipment for her business.

Loida has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Loida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipment for her business

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
This is the story of Tri, daughter of Sri :

I come from a poor family. My father is Sri, and my mother is Boiman. I am the 3rd of 5 children. My father works as a laborer, and my mother as a housewife. I have 2 brothers and 2 sisters. My first brother is married. One of my sisters recently graduated vocational school, and is still looking for a job in town. My other siblings are still in school. They go to school by bicycle, while I am sometimes driven to school by my father. Other times I hitchhike with my classmates.

Although my father's occupation is laborer, he does not always have work. Sometimes he does whatever is legal in order to provide for the family. My father works when he can, while my mother looks after the household. Sometimes my father gets 50,000 per day from his work, but the money is divided up for our daily needs. My pocket money every day is just 3.000, and even then I often do not have breakfast because I can't afford to buy it. I sincerely hope that this Kiva loan will help ease the burden on my family. 

I am determined to help my parents after graduation, and I want to make them happy. That is a glimpse of my family's economy. Thanks for your attention and thank you for Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Asminah

texts.en:
Asminah is 54 years old and a single parent. She lives with her children. She has one son and one daughter. She usually sells food and rice in the morning.  She has done this over eight years for family income

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,500,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home for improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family.  Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home for improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Victoria is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Victoria has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, fish container, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, fish container, gasoline, etc. for her business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a 34-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, beans, cucumbers, and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Theresa has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, rakes, etc.  She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Theresa hopes to save money for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Harch

texts.en:
Harch (in the photo here) is 30 years old and lives in the Khsach Kandal district along the Mekong Rever. She has been married since 2011 and has three sons; they are still young.

Presently, Harch has sold fish for two years in her own business, while her husband is a soldier, with 20 years' experience. 

She would like to apply for a loan to build a new house .She said that she has some money but needs more to add to cover every expense in the construction.

She hopes that the loan will help her get a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Neneta

texts.en:
Neneta is 26 years old and married, with one child.  She resides at Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur, with her family. 

She owns and operates a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been in the business for a year and earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

She repaid successfully her previous loan, used for buying tires and accessories for her motorcycle. 

She is now taking a new loan to repaint her motorcycle and buy a new brake pad for safe travel with customers. 

Neneta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repaint her motorcycle and buy a new brake pad for safe travel with customers.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. Three of her children are in school. Paulina raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Paulina has been raising pigs for two years, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Paulina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mairamkan

texts.ru: Майрамкан, 49 лет, замужем,6 детей. На протяжении 26 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Супруг и дети активно помогают матери. В хозяйстве Майрамкан на сегодняшний день есть: 3 коровы, 11 овец, а также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,0 ГА, она выращивает арбузы, хлопчатник и огурцы. Майрамкан является лидером группы "Жаштык", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и клеенки для полеводческих нужд, чтобы иметь возможность выращивать экологически чистые овощи и фрукты. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Майрамкан и ее семьи, и накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Mairamkan is 49 years old, married and has 6 children. She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 26 years. Her husband and children actively help her. Today Mairamkan's farm contains 3 cows, 11 sheep, and a 1.0 hectare land plot, where she grows watermelons, cotton and cucumbers. Mairamkan is a leader of the "Jashtyk" group that, besides her, consists of 2 more people. In order to further develop her business, Mairamkan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic for farming needs and to be able to grow ecologically clean vegetables and fruits. The earnings from the business will help improve Mairamkan's and her family's well-being and save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic for farming needs and to be able to grow ecologically clean vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ursula is 40 years old and all of her children are in school.

Ursula has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. Ursula requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of coffee, milk and sugar for her cafeteria.

Ursula has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ursula would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of coffee, milk and sugar for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a vegetable business for 15 years.

Lucia requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kutman

texts.ru: Кутман, 22 года, не женат. У него неоконченное высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 2 года назад. Благодаря упорному труду Кутмана, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 30 овец и 1,0 Га земли, где он выращивает помидоры, хлопчатник, дыню. Кутман входит в группу "Жаштык", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и клеенки для парника. Доходы от кредита Кутман планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Kutman is 22 years old and not married. He has an unfinished college education and, to provide the primary income, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 2 years. Thanks to Kutman's hard work, today his farm contains 2 cows, 30 sheep, and a 1.0 hectares of land, where he grows tomatoes, cotton and cantaloupe. Kutman is a member of the "Jashtyk" group that consists of 2 more people, with three of them all together. In order to further develop his business, Kutman requested a loan in the amount of 75,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic for his greenhouse. Kutman plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing his livestock headcount and saving money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic for his greenhouse in order to grow vegetables

loans.name: Rosemila

texts.en: Rosemila is 47 years old and married with 3 children. She has been farming for many years to provide income for her family. Her husband is a carpenter. She asked for a loan to purchase organic fertilizer to restore soil nutrients to increase her harvest. She is now happy to say that with this loan the entire farm will be fertilized, and the farm will be more productive into the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore soil nutrients to increase her harvest.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is a 42-year-old  married woman with five children. Four attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Epefania has had a fish vending business for 4 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTFto buy more fish to sell.

 In the future, Epefania would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita works hard to support her family. Cristita is married and has had a motorcycle transportation business for 10 years.

Cristita requested 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business.

Cristita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Suparjan

texts.en:
This is the story of Yohan, son of Suparjan :

My father is a farmer, who can not meet the monthly school fees, but does fulfill the daily needs. Sometimes, our daily needs are not  met because my father is the only one to earn a living. My mother had long parted company with his father and has never been concerned with the family. My sisters are young.

 I chose vocational school in  Sidareja and expect to graduate, work in my field, and became a successful son.  I can help meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 47 years old and married.  

Myrna has raised pigs for 15 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 17 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nursuluu

texts.ru: Нурсулуу,34 года, замужем, 7 детей. У Нурсулуу средне-специальное образование, она на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес в 2010 году почти с нуля. На сегодняшний день прибыль Нурсулуу составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. У нее в хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 41 овца, также на земельном наделе мерою 1,3 ГА она выращивает хлопчатник, помидоры, дыни, экологически чистую, вкусную продукцию, она реализует оптовым покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурсулуу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрения для обработки земли, семян и клеенки для теплицы. Доходы от кредита Нурсулуу планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Nursuluu is 34 years old, married and has 7 children. Nursuluu has a specialized secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for many years, starting this business in 2010 with almost nothing. Today Nursuluu's profit amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS) per month. Her farm contains 5 cows, 41 sheep, and 1.3 hectares of land, where she grows cotton, tomatoes and cantaloupe. She sells her ecologically-clean and delicious produce to wholesale customers. In order to further develop her business, Nursuluu requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy fertilizers for treating the soil, seeds and plastic for her greenhouse. Nursuluu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into continued development of her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for treating the soil, seeds and plastic for her greenhouse

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es: Rosa de 42 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 12 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a viernes tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Rosa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She has been running a beauty salon in her home for 12 years, working from Monday to Friday. Rosa has many customers as she does a good job. With the profits she earns and with the help of her husband, she is able to cover household costs. Rosa is applying for a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon, including creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors and other items that she needs. She can then earn higher profits that will give her more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds for growing potatoes and organic and chemical manure.

loans.name: Poeu

texts.en:
Peou (here in photo) is 58 years old.  She lives in the Khsach Kandal district along the Mekong river.  She had been married since 1979 and has five sons and three daughters. Seven are married and other one is still young. 

Peou is a farmer who plants lotuses with 10 years of experience.  Her husband is a fisherman with 10 years of experience.  She wants to apply for a loan to purchase wood to repair her house because the house is old, so she wants to repair it to make it better.   

She is committed that she will have a new house and a comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: buy timber to repair her house

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio es estudiante Universitario de la carrera de ingeniería agrónoma, es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, estudia  para salir adelante, y ser un profesional útil a los demás.
Su sueño es terminar esta carrera y el día de mañana trabajar por su propia cuenta
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de tesis, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene, y que debe cubrir. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Florencio is a university student who is studying for a degree in Agricultural Engineering. He is a responsible, honest, and hardworking individual. Florencio is studying in order to get ahead, as well as become a useful professional to others. His dream is to finish his degree and someday work on his own.

Florencio is requesting this loan so that he can cover his thesis expenses. As a result, he will have the funds to pay for this outstanding expense. He appreciates the opportunity he has received since it will be very useful.

loans.use: to pay his thesis expenses.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy earns a living offering printing, photocopying, and lamination services. She is married and lives in Maloro, Tangub City. She is now well known for the nice quality of printing and photocopying output she serves, and earns a net profit of about PHP 9,000 per month. 

To generate more income, Daisy is seeking a PHP 40,000 loan to buy an additional photocopier machine to provide efficient and quick service and to serve more customers. In her 2 previous loans she has never had a delinquency. Daisy is very diligent and loves accuracy which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: buy a photocopier

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is a strong-willed man who pushes his ability when it comes to his piggery business. He is a hands-on businessman and father who never gets tired of supporting his family. Recently, he requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feed.  Aside from his project of concreting the pig pens, he thought of adding more pigs for commercial sale.  Someday he hopes to open a meat shop in the nearby town.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn owns a tailoring business and a farm supplies business. She is happily married and blessed with five children. Two of her children have settled into marriage, two are still attending school and one is working. The couple aims to increase their profit and make their businesses viable sources of income. Jocelyn has been involved in her tailoring business for 20 years and in her farm supplies business for 25. 

With her determination to have continuous growth for her businesses, she is seeking additional capital of 50,000 PHP. This amount will be used to purchase fabrics and threads for her tailoring business and to invest in her farm supplies business. She hopes that through this loan, she can satisfy all her customers' demands and produce quality clothes and curtains to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and threads for her tailoring business and to invest in her farm supplies business

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
In 2000, Josefa learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Josefa tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owe her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Josefa has borrowed another loan to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. Josefa looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: buy seedlings and compost

loans.name: Isidro Jr

texts.en:
Isidro Jr is very dedicated to his study and  wants to become successful in the future.  He studies Marine Engineering at a university. His parents are  earning income from employment as drivers. He has two siblings and is living with his family. 

Isidro Jr borrowed this loan from GDMPC for the purpose of paying the school tuition fee for his first semester.  In the future, he wants to have a business that will enable him to support himself and his family.

loans.use: pay university tuition

loans.name: Amor

texts.en: Amor is single and living with her family in a village in Zamboanga del Sur. She studies for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology at the university because she wants to help her family in the future. She used her previous loan for her school expenses and recently is taking a new loan to pay for the school tuition fee for the second semester.  She is thankful of the Cooperative in helping those deserving students to fulfill their dreams of having a better future.

loans.use: pay her university tuition

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en: Phebe runs a general store selling goods in her village to make a living. She has been doing this for over six years and earns well for her needs. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for her store improvement. To increase her sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods, rice and feeds to sell in her store. She is hopeful of gaining more income to expand her business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a visionary. She operates a farm where she grows rice. She has been involved in this business for over eight years. Her business is located in a fertile area. Aside from this, she also had a grocery store for their daily needs.  

Rosalinda will use this loan to pay for farm labor and buy farm inputs. The organic fertilizer and pesticides will help her to have an abundant harvest. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en: Honorata is married with five children and  earns a living from selling charcoal in the market. Her earnings go to her children's education costs. She earns well from this business and was able to start up a grocery store  business. To add to her capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase sacks of rice & corn and grocery goods to sell. She hopes to buy a vehicle to be used for her business in the future.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Zedis

texts.es: Comidas rápidas, hamburguesas, carne pollo asado son las líneas de productos que ofrece Zedis en su negocio ubicado al sur de la ciudad, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 11, 9 años y 8 meses de nacido. Ella ideó este negocio, observando que su hermano tenia guardado, equipos y herramientas y se encontraban en capacidad ociosa. Viendo esto como una oportunidad de ponerlos a funcionar decisió iniciar un puesto de comidas rápidas desde el año pasado y hasta la presente ha funcionado muy bien. Zedis trabaja de viernes a domingos y festivos, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche, vende de contado y sus principales clientes se encuentran en el sector donde habita. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia vivienda, y ampliar y adecuar su infraestructura de negocios, para ello planea crecer, y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará insumos como salsas, materias primas como embutidos panas y cárnicos. Con esta inversión su productividad aumentará su negocio esta´ra mas surtido y esto es justamente el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Fast food, hamburgers and grilled chicken meat are the product lines that Zedis offers in her business, located south of the city. This is where she lives with her spouse and three children, who are ages 11, 9 and 8 months. She devised this business noting that her brother had stored equipment and tools that were not being used. Seeing this as an opportunity, last year she decided to put them to work and start a fast food place. Her business has done very well up to now.

Zedis works from Friday to Sunday and on holidays, from 5 a.m. to 11 p.m.  She makes cash sales and her main customers come from her area of residence. Her goal is to later own her own residence and expand and upgrade her business infrastructure. To do so, she plans to grow and is applying for a Kiva loan, her first funding from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase supplies, such as salsa and basic materials like sausages, bread and meat. 

With this investment, her productivity will increase, her business will be better stocked and this will lead precisely to a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as salsa, and basic materials like sausages, bread and meat.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 36 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Luciana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luciana has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luciana would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mahmudin

texts.en:
This is the story of Endang, daughter of Mahmudin:

I come from a poor family, the youngest of 5 siblings.  My mother is long dead, my father is 62 years old and has not worked due to illness.

To meet our daily needs my sisters assisted. My three sisters are married, and one is not married.  My school fees needs very little. Hopefully this Kiva loan really help ease the burden for my brother, because my brother has to support two families at once.

That's a bit of a profile of my family. Thank you.

loans.use: pay her vocational school tuition

loans.name: Tulozizi Group

texts.fr: Kapenda s'est engagé depuis 1990 dans la culture du riz et du manioc; il a enfin opté pour le riz à cause de son cycle végétatif de courte durée (4 mois) et des récoltes qui lui permettent de réunir dans un temps record de revenus. Il disposait d'un peu de fonds pour l'achat de semences et a dû louer un champ. Ce crédit lui permettra de supporter la main d'oeuvre pour les travaux de sarclage ainsi que l'acquisition de l'engrais et insecticides qui lui posent souvent problème faute de moyens. Le prix à la récolte est souvent revu au rabais lors de la vente car les clients cherchent à imposer leur prix; toutefois, il estime louer d'autres champs et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Président du groupe TULOZIZI, il s'affiche sur la photo debout avec un carnet rose dans sa main.
texts.en:
Kapenda is the president of the TULOZIZI group; in the photo, he is standing with a pink booklet in his hand.

Kapenda started farming rice and cassava in 1990; he eventually settled on rice due to its shorter growing cycle of 4 months, and harvests that bring much quicker income. He had enough money to buy seeds, and had to lease a field.
