This loan will help him to cover the cost of labor needed for weeding, and to pay for fertilizers and pesticides, which are often in short supply for lack of funds. 

The crops are often sold at a discount because the customers attempt to set the price. 

Kapenda’s goals are to lease more fields, and to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to cover the cost of labor needed for weeding and plowing, and to pay for fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn (in photo) is 47 years old and lives in Khsach Kandal district along the Mekong River.  Khorn had been married since 1995 and has one son .

Khorn has been selling vegetable for 10 years, and her husband is a guardman for a company with 1 year in this work.  Khorn would like to apply for a loan to buy vegetables to store for resale because of she wants to increase her capital.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby, she earns an income as well.  At the age of 66 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative the capital used in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, Caridad applied a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers to keep her flower healthy. In the future, Caridad wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: buy gardening tools & fertilizer

loans.name: Lordiana

texts.en: Lordiana thought she was in the right place when she joined Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her business. Lordiana has maintained her membership in good standing without record of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins to sustain her pigs. Lordiana wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 33 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is separated and has 2 school-age children. She has a shop that sells different kinds of personal products like accessories, clothes and sandals. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan to purchase office supplies, toys and fashion accessories for more sales. 

Julieta has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes that she will earn more to support the financial needs of her children.

loans.use: buy personal products to sell

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is a hardworking woman. She is divorced and has one child. She is only supporter for her child,  so she began her own business 2 years ago with the aim to earn a living. 

Nigora offers the services of a cosmetologist. She has a rental office where she offers her services. Thanks to her good service and her high knowledge she has regular customers.  Nigora always tries to improve her knowledge and in this way develop her business. 

Nigora is asking for a loan of 3500 Somonis to buy cosmetics and to pay for office rental. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your kindness.

loans.use: buy cosmetics & pay office rent

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Dilafruz is 38 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all deals. She has her own sewing business, which she has been doing for 10 years. The national Tajik women's dresses sewn by Dilafruz are wonderful because she has a good taste and rich imagination. She has own workshop in the center of her town. Because of her good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. 

Dilafruz requested a loan, which she will use to purchase a sewing machine so that she can develop her business further.  She hopes to provide her children with a better quality of life

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is thirty-seven years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jenilyn 's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regain what she lost.  Jenilyn is taking out a PHP 10000 jousing loan through NWTF to  purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a new house for her family.

Jenilyn has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Jenilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: rebuild her house

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 52 years old and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cristita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Cristita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home. 

Cristita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is 27 years old and has two children. She is married and both her children are in school.

Cindy and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. Cindy is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Cindy has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fish-vending business. With your help, Cindy can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Sukiman

texts.en:
This is the story of Marga, son of Sukiman :

I come from a poor family. My father works as a common laborer and my mother as a housewife.  My father's income is less than 1 million IDRs per month.  I am the third child of three brothers.

The income from my father is not able to meet our daily needs, and especially for my school fees and my sister's. But I keep the spirit to go to school because I wanted to be successful and able to assist my parents after I graduate from school later.

loans.use: pay for his vocational school fees

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Jane. This borrower is blessed with good looks, sensitivity, and a great deal of courage. She lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in manicured tea plantations and banana farming. 

Jane is a mother of 10 children and she has been in the agriculture business for 20 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea. Jane has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, the rising costs of farming inputs, such as for fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Jane remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Jane is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Jane will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her is timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality products and more yields. This loan will support Jane’s economic activity and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.

loans.use: buy poultry

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is a single woman. She is fifty-eight years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marcosa's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost .Marcosa is taking out a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her a house for her family.

Marcosa has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Marcosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: rebuild her house

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Stella, who is a 55-year-old smallholder farmer from Nkubu in the central region of Kenya.  Stella owns a 2-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. This mother of five keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming. 

Stella is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output.  Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Stella. 

Through a group of 10 members called Mwendatu, Stella has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitate loans that empower smallholder farmers like Stella because the institution believe that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: expand her farm

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is 38 years old, married, and has two children, who attend school. She works hard to provide for her family. Augustina runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Augustina requested her third loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 32 years old and married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Zenaida has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items to sell like died fish, soap, noodles and other groceries. Zenaida has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like died fish, soap, noodles and others.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Twenty years ago Pamela started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kiabonyoru, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. Today, she sells milk, tea, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow. Although she earns a profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit. She requested a loan, which she will use to build a modern dairy unit. With the loan, she will have an easier time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax. It can also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions. Pamela believes that with this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en: Mastura was born in 1971. She is married and has a child. Mastura’s husband is Askaraly. He is a kind man and always helps Mastura. Mastura works hard every day. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years. She mainly feeds cows. Mastura has a big cowshed where she feeds cows. She sells milk and milk products to local people. Mastura’s husband helps her to feed the cows. She is going to increase the number of milk cows and in this way improve business. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy a cow. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Yohanes

texts.en: Yohanes is 48 years old, married and has four children, three of whom attend school. He is a civil servant and his wife is a housewife. Beside working, Yohanes is now studying at a university to achieve his Bachelor's degree in education faculty. He requested a loan from TLM for 7,500,000 IDR, which he will use for his and his son's, who is also a university student, semester registration fees and other compulsory fees.

loans.use: to pay his and his son's semester registration fees and other compulsory fees

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 35 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Corazon has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a fish pond operator business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing and raising ducks. Nida is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her fish pond operator business.

Nida  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her fish.

loans.name: Aem

texts.en:
Aem is a 20-year-old, single student in his second year at an institute and he is taking a banking and finance major. He is from Prey Veng province of Cambodia. 

Since Aem has been lacking finances to pay his tuition fees for three years, he decided to apply for a loan. This loan will help him to successfully graduate in order to build his future. 

After graduation, Aem wants to have a good job with a reasonable salary, so he will be able to save money to renovate his house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
Zaynura is a woman who some years ago began business to support her family. She is 27 years old. She has no children and she is the main feed keeper in the family. She lives in a village. Local people have been busy with animal husbandry and farming. Zaynura also grows crops and vegetables such as potatoes, onion, wheat and maize. She works every day from early morning until late evening on her own land. She knows her business very well and has great experience. Her husband helps her to grow crops and vegetables. She sells her harvest at the local market. She has her own customers as her harvest has high quality. She wants to develop business further and to get a good profit.
 
With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. She has many perfect plans for the future and tries to realize them. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Sohida

texts.en: Sohida is 35 years old. She is divorced and has no children. Sohida lives alone in a rural area. She has been busy with a farming business for more than 10 years. Her relations help her to grow crops and vegetables. Sohida mainly grows potatoes and wheat and sells the harvest in a local market. Sohida plans to buy seeds of potatoes for the new sowing season and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy seeds. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Sultonbek

texts.en:
Sultonbek is married and lives in a small village in North Tajikistan.

Sultonbek has always worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans. He has worked in this business for more than five years. He sells his harvest in the zone where he lives, and that is how he makes an income to provide for his family. 

He is preparing for the next season and is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. His plan is to continue increasing production to generate more household income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 19-year-old single, young man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a very simple house. His father works as an employee with a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Yousef is a student in a local university where he studies graphic design.
 
Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. He needs a laptop to practice and do his homework. 

Yousef appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 42 years old and single. She lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has a shop that sells different flavors of delicious cakes. She has been in the business for 2 years. She requested a loan to purchase baking ingredients like flour, bananas, and chocolate flavors for cakes to supply the demand of her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to find her partner in life and have her own family.

loans.use: to purchase baking ingredients like flour, bananas, and chocolate flavors for cakes.

loans.name: Ferdinan

texts.en: Ferdinan is a 50-year-old man who is married to Veronika, a 36-year-old woman. They are blessed with 5 children in their marriage, namely Benyamin, 25, a worker; Regilinda, 22, a worker; Yane, 13, who just graduated from Elementary School; Meki, 8, a 3rd grade Elementary School student; and the last is Ignalea, 6, a 1st grade Elementary School student. Everyday, he goes to the traditional market and sells chicks, pigs or goats. His wife, Veronika, is a vegetable farmer. Ferdinan is now building his new house but he lacks of money to buy more materials. He has requested an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. The loan will be spent on more building materials such as cement, bricks and iron.

loans.use: to purchase more building materials such as cement, bricks and iron.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 52 years old and lives in Tambulig, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 3 adult children.

She has a shop that sells meat and has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan to buy pigs to sell their meat in her shop and provide fresh meat to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

In the future, Avelina hopes that God will continue bless her business to help others.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell in her meat shop.

loans.name: Yeremias

texts.en:
Yeremias is a 30-year-old man who is married to Weltrudis, a 29 year old woman. Both of them are Civil Servants. They are blessed with 2 daughters in their marriage: Kristin, 3 years old, and Luisa, a 7-month-old baby. 

Although Yeremias already has his own family,  he still has responsibility to cover his brother’s education fees. His brother Adrianus, who is 22, is studying at University in semester 7th. Currently, Yeremias is applying for an individual loan from TLM of 3,000,000 Indonesia Rupiahs (IDR). The loan will be spent on the semester registration fees and other college requirements.

loans.use: to pay for registration fees and other college requirements.

loans.name: Jaelani

texts.en:
This is the story of Dani, son of Jaelani:


I come from a family that cannot afford. My father and my mother are named Jaelani and Sukarsih. I am the second child of three brothers. My father works as a small-time trader by selling ice shakes, and my mother works as a laborer. My mother and my father do not benefit daily, and revenue is only enough to meet their daily needs, while there is not enough for our school fees.

Moreover, soon I will follow in the Prakerin program.  The cost of Prakerin is very big.  Since I was in grade 2, my father has tried to save from the wares everyday of 10,000 - for preparation of Prakerin costs. May God continue to give health to both my parents, and I am very grateful that I proposed to get a student loan, and I truly hope that this Kiva loan will greatly help ease the burden on my parents for this.

I am determined to be diligent and persevering in school and after I graduate, so that can help my parents. I want to be successful and independent and both of my parents can be happy. Thanks for your attention Similarly, a glimpse of my family profile. 

In the picture is  Dani, and Jaelani, Sukarsih his mother.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 57 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Emelyn has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Emelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc

loans.name: Daisy Cecilia

texts.es: Daisy, habitante del municipio de Santo Tomás, es una emprendedora joven de apenas 20 años, quien decidió empender su negocio de comidas rápidas en el año 2006. Gracias a que ella había aprendido a elaborar estas comidas, un día decidió incursionar en este negocio, y lo hizo solamente preparando sándwich, porque era lo que mas delicioso le quedaba; así poco a poco fue adicionando a la carta, perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchipapas, entre otros, acompañandolos con refrescos.  Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, quienes degustan deliciosos platillos, que prepara esta emprendedora mujer.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos, como carnes frías, pan, verduras, entre otros derivados, para la preparación de sus comidas. Daisy tiene dos hijas de 5 años y 10 años, ella desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia por ello su principal desafío es acceder a mas fuentes de financiación en pro de mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Daisy lives in the Santo Tomás municipality.  She is an enterprising young woman who is just 20 years old.  She decided to undertake her fast food business in the year 2006.  Thanks to the fact that she had learned to make these foods, she one day decided to enter into this business.  She did so by only preparing sandwiches because it was the most delicious option for her.  

This way she was, little by little, adding to the menu with hot dogs, hamburgers, and ‘salchipapas’ [a dish made with sausage and French fries], among others.  These were accompanied with soft drinks.  Her main customers are her neighbors, who enjoy delicious dishes that are prepared by this enterprising woman.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy supplies like cold meats, bread, and vegetables, among other products for the preparation of her food.

Daisy has two daughters, ages 5 and 10.  She wishes to improve her family’s quality of life.  Her main challenge in doing so is accessing more sources of financing to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies like cold meats, bread, and vegetables, among other products for the preparation of her food.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin is 48 years old. He is married with two children. One of them is a 15 years old boy. He is in ninth grade and the other is a 10-year-old daughter who is in fourth grade. Shahin’s wife is a tailor. His family has been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land for 22 years already. Now they are living in Fuzuli region.

Some time ago, Shahin started his business. For this purpose, he opened an area where he planned to sell vegetables and fruit. Now he needs a loan of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to increase this area. He is very thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for the loan and the help to increase his business. In the future, he wants to open a work place for his wife.

loans.use: to increase his work area and increase his business. In the future, he wants to open a work place for his wife

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Astou, âgée de 30 ans, habite un village situé à quelques kilomètres de la ville principale. Elle vit en famille, avec ses parents et ses frères et sœurs. Astou prépare des jus à base de pain de singe, oseille, gingembre, lait, qu’elle revend dans les écoles. Elle pratique ce métier depuis plus de 5 ans maintenant. Elle s’active aussi dans la couture.
Astou s’occupe du payement de ses factures et de ses divers petits besoins personnels. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Astou désire s’investir à fond dans l’avenir dans son atelier par l’achat d’une machine gros fil.
texts.en:
Astou, who is 30 years old, lives in a town several kilometers from the main town. She lives in a family with her parents, brothers, and sisters. 

Astou works making juice from baobab fruit, hibiscus, ginger, and milk, which she resells in the schools. She has been doing this for more than five years now. She also works as a seamstress.

Astou takes care of her bills and various small personal needs. She also helps to cover her family's everyday expenses. She wishes to invest in the future of her workshop by buying a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make juice

loans.name: 030918180001.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She is 52 years old and she is married with three children.
Huệ is the group leader of the 030918180001.Thiệu Dương Solidarity Group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2005, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 46 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Emelita works very hard to provide for them.

Emelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emelita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, diapers, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Emelita would like to build and expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and clothing.

For the past three years she has operated a livestock selling business, selling at the market and to the passerbys in the community. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business.

With the loan of 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more goats for reselling. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business and get financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for reselling.

loans.name: 030913130001.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dân has a business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell.

Dân is 37 years old and married with two children. Dân is the group leader of the 030913130001.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Dân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dân has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years and the main hardship that Dân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dân hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Couna

texts.fr:
Madame Couna, fait parti des premiers clients de ce guichet d’IMCEC de cette zone. Elle a déjà reçu 3 financements de cette dernière dans le cadre d’améliorer son travail.  Son activité qui consiste  à la vente de bijoux, qu’elle fait depuis plus de 10 ans déjà. Elle est pris en charge par son époux et n’a pratiquement pas de charges sinon les petits besoins de se enfants et petits enfants. Elle fait cette activité pour s’occuper et ne pas se sédentariser.
Son souhait le plus cher serait de voir ses enfants réussir dans la vie et avoir un bon départ, pour cela elle essaie toujours de les appuyer dans ce cadre.
texts.en:
Couna was one of the first clients with this UIMCEC branch. She has already received financing three times to improve her business. 

Couna has worked selling jewelry for ten years already. She is supported by her husband, so she doesn't have any expenses except the small needs of her children and grandchildren.

Her dearest wish is to see her children succeed in their lives and to have a good start. For this reason, she always tries to support them.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Mikhael

texts.en:
Mikhael is a 45 year old man who is married to Maria, a 34 year old woman. They are blessed with 2 daughters and 2 sons: Elsi, 14, a 2nd grade student at Junior High School; Ayu, 9, an Elementary school student in 5th grade; Petrus, 6; and Silvester, 4. The younger 2 children are not attending school yet.

Mikhael and Maria have had a chicken breeding business since 2012. They also have paddy fields which are cultivated by themselves. They lived in a small house and they plan to build a new bigger house. Therefore, Mikhael is applying for an individual loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. The loan will be used to buy more building materials such as zinc, cement, and nails.

loans.use: to buy more building materials such as zinc, cement, and nails.

loans.name: Elpidus

texts.en:
Elpidus is a 29 year old man who works as an Elementary School teacher. He is not married yet. He lives with his parents, Firnus, 63, and Yasinta, 63. He has 4 siblings: Victor, 32; Nona, 30; Hendrina, 27; and Bernadus, 25. All of them are workers. 

Besides teaching at school, Elpidus is now taking his Bachelor degree at a local university. Currently, he is requesting an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. The loan will be used to pay his graduation fees, as he is going to finish his education in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay his graduation fees

loans.name: 03.05.01 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng operates a food stall/restaurant selling processed food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to process and sell. Hằng is 42 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 03.05.01 Quảng Hưng Solidarity Group, which consists of four members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2013, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hằng has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Hằng hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more food to process and sell.

loans.name: 02030617Đại Long- Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng works in agriculture, raising poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise, and sell in future. Hồng is 56 years old, and she is married and has four children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 02030617Đại Long- Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. Hồng lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hồng has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng has been involved in her agriculture business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise, and sell in future.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Tabu owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

Tabu has operated a charcoal  selling business for over two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for reselling. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and married, with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

Elizabeth has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is in school. Rosita and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Rosita is taking out a housing loan amounting 9,500 PHP to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Rosita has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her buy-and-sell fish business. With your help, Rosita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old and married; she has six children. With two children in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She plans to use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell. Jocelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as sardines, soft-drinks, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha is a married woman; she has six children, all of whom attend school. Zulekha owns a house that has  neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zulekha has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for reselling.

loans.name: Katsele

texts.en:
Katsele is a married woman and has two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a livestock business, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan of 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase more goats to resell. She decided to join Yehu, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell

loans.name: Djiby

texts.fr:
Monsieur Djiby, âgé de la cinquantaine d’année ; est un client fidèle à la caisse car il est à son onzième crédit. Il est marié et père de famille et ne vit que son activité d’embouche. Djiby a hérité son métier de son père et de ses ancêtres. L’élevage de bœuf est le métier le plus ancien des peulhs qui le font de génération en génération. Djiby va acheter des bœufs qu’il va emboucher pour les revendre, mais aussi pour produire du lait qu’il commercialise aussi.
Il s’occupe des charges familiales et de l’éducation de ses enfants. 
Vu qu’il a réussi à mettre un peu d’argent de coté, Djiby songe à investir dans une ferme avicole où il pourra élever des poulets de chair en grande quantité.
texts.en:
Djiby, who is in his fifties, has been a loyal client; he is on his eleventh loan. He is married and a father of a family, and they live off his working with animals. He inherited this work from his father and his ancestors. Raising cattle is a long standing tradition with the Peulhs, who have been doing this for generations.

Djiby is going to buy cattle that he will fatten and resell. He will also produce milk to sell.

He takes care of his family expenses and his children's schooling. 

Considering that he has been able to put a little money aside, Djiby is considering investing in a poultry farm where he can raise a large number of broiler chickens.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and resell

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman, who has seven children. Not all of her children attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Farida has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood sellers, in her business.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Cressel Pamela

texts.en:
Cressel Pamela is tending her little sari-sari store in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 40 years old, with two school-aged children and she is happily married. 

Her sari-sari store is the only way she generates income and sustains her family's needs. But, the demand of her customers is too high for her. 

Cressel Pamela requests a loan to purchase soft drinks, canned goods, candies, etc.to sustain the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, canned goods, candies, etc. to sustain the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. Kadzo owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kadzo has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition in her business from other firewood operators. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married mother of three children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. She faces major challenges of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is married and lives in Tukuran with his family. He earns better income from his transportation business and is able to support his family. He also bought some home appliances from his generated income. His previous loan was used for maintenance of his store and it was repaid successfully. 

To make his services more comfortable and safe, he took a new loan recently to purchase new body parts for vehicle repair. He plans to use his profits to buy a motorcycle for improvement and expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase new body parts for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Bisan

texts.en:
Bisan is a 19-year-old, single lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small, humble house. Her father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.

Bisan studies elementary education at the university. She is in her second year. She would like to complete her studies and find a job as a teacher, to help her family cover part of their expenses.

Bisan requested a US Dollar Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Bisan will be able to do her homework and read articles online. Bisan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies in elementary education, at university

loans.name: Kahunda

texts.en:
Kahunda is a widowed mother with five children, four of whom attend school and one is too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a kiosk business selling food. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of competition. She dreams of expanding her business. With the loan of 30,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase iron sheets for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets for her shop.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leny operates a bakery in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Leny requested a loan from NWTF for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her bakery. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Fundi

texts.en:
Fundi is a married woman and living together with her husband and four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. With the loan of 40,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school (the other is still young for school). She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Eunice has operated a charcoal-selling business for seven years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 50,000 loan, Eunice wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs, in the Philippines.

Geronima requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been fattening pigs for 20 years, now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a married woman, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Belinda is fifty years old now.

Belinda's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her buy-and-sell fish business, and she is committed to regaining what she lost.

She is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing Loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor, to build a house for her family.

Belinda has been with NWTF since 2012, in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more, in a new home. In the future, Belinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to recover from typhoon damage, by building her family a house

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila has been farming for many years and she earns a good income. She used her previous loan for additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She was able to raise more and was financially prepared for the next cropping season. 

Cirila requested another loan, which she will use to purchase organic fertilizer to restore nutrients to have a productive harvest. With this loan, the entire farm will be fertilized for a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 45% of Kenya's gross domestic product, generates 70% of Kenya’s export revenue, and employs approximately 70% of Kenyans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Kenya remain under-served by financial institutions. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet Nelly, an ever-smiling young farmer from Kapsowar County, in Kenya. She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is a proud owner of a small parcel of land, on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business, in order to make ends meet. Nelly passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow.

Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best-quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. Nelly is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow, which will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With the loan, she will buy a dairy cow that can produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, Nelly attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her to save more money, to repay the loan fully, and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
Pricilla is a widowed mother of three children; one of them attends school and the others do not because they are adults. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Pricilla dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 10,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 62 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lilia has been farming rice for 9 years now and has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman and has six children, of whom three attend school and three are still too young. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business, selling milk, for the past one year. She faces a challenge with regard to transportation, in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of milk. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of milk.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is 40 years old and is happily married with 4 school-age children. She lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has been a farmer for many years and became a member of PMPC in 2008.

Consorcia has requested a loan amount of PHP 20,000 to buy sacks of fertilizers for her farming site. This will help her to have a good harvest for the next cropping season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers for her farming business

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat was born in 1984. She is not married and lives with her  parents. Khosiyat is a highly educated person. She has pedagogical education. 

Khosiyat has worked as a teacher in a local school for more than four years. She teaches Russian language and literature. She has a lot of pupils who like her classes. Khosiyat has a good reputation among her colleagues. 

Khosiyat needs financial support now. She is ill and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy medicines for her treatment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a business manufacturing native mats in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Victoria is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her native-mat making business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native-mat making.

loans.name: Mnyuzi

texts.en:
Mnyuzi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mnyuzi operates a grocery vegetable stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a open shop business in the future. With the loan she is requesting of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase two crates of tomatoes, onions and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two crates of tomatoes, onions and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a divorced mother of two children, of whom one attends school and the other one is still too young. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door, to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of the high cost of transportation, and seasonality. She dreams of expanding, and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting, KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Maisha

texts.en:
Maisha is a married woman and has three children, of whom two attend school and one is still too young for school. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years. There, she sells household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, KES 30,000, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 42 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Erlinda and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Erlinda is taking out a housing loan amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Erlinda has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fish vending.

With your help, Erlinda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is married and a mother of three and lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetable selling business, selling to the community. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business and hopes to open another business, such as a retail shop. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to help her to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married mother with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions, as well as a blow dryer, two mirrors, and four seats. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions, as well as a blow dryer, two mirrors, and four seats

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Floriana owns a house that has has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Floriana has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her community and passersby. She mentioned transportation as her major challenge in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 59 years old, married, and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rebecca has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is fifty-three years old and has one child in school.

Elizabeth's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her buy and sell fish business and is committed to regain what she lost. Elizabeth is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Elizabeth has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Mary Rose successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Mary Rose's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who is still young. Her largest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

For the past year, she has operated a kiosk selling mineral water to the passersby and neighbors. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge she faces. She dreams of opening a new water kiosk in the future.

With the loan of 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of mineral water for resale. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of mineral water for resale

loans.name: Ngina

texts.en:
Ngina is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zainab has operated a food selling business, making dumplings, and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Fatuma operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 15 years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, Fatuma wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a married mother of three children, who all attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a coconuts selling business, selling retail to her local customers. Clara cites the high cost of transportation as her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and purchasing a motorcycle for distributing coconuts in the near future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase 5 sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Saidazam

texts.en: Saidazam was born in 1991. He lives and studies at the capital of Tajikistan. Saidazam has applied to the Finance-economic University of Tajikistan after graduating school. He studied well at the university and so after graduating university has applied to the magistracy. Saidazam studies well in magistracy also. He is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente, 35 years old, is married with four children. He earns a living from selling grocery goods in their village. He also has a transportation service-based business and is earning well from this. His earnings go to his children's education costs.

To add to his capital, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy additional volume of grocery goods to cater to his customers’ demand.

He is aiming to develop his business and increase his profits so that he could possibly repair their house for a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional volume of grocery goods to cater to his customers' demand.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a cosmetic selling shop business, selling retail to her neighbors and passerby. Potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase stocks of cosmetics and food stuff for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics and food stuff for resale.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia works hard to support her family. Rodelia is married and has a buy and sell crabs business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of crabs to sell.

Rodelia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rodelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of crabs to sell

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a married mother of five school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Winnie has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Serkizhan

texts.ru: Серкижан, 55 год, вдова, мать 5 детей. У Серкижан- среднее образование, у нее большой трудовой опыт, работала продавцом, сортировщицей и воспитателем, сейчас на пенсии и занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая фасоль на 2,33 ГА собственной земли. Также в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 1 бычок и 15 овец, экологически чистое молоко и пшеницу она реализует местным жителям. Продукция пользуется большим спросом. Ежемесячный доход Серкижан от бизнеса около 5,000 сом (KGS), этого не хватает на достойную жизнь, несмотря на дополнительный доход от пенсии. Поэтому Серкижан решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Серкижан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что поможет ей улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Serkizhan is 55 years old, a widow and a mother of 5 children. Serkizhan has a secondary education and has an extensive work experience. She previously worked as a salesperson, sorter and daycare teacher. Now she is retired and involved in animal husbandry and farming, growing beans on 2.33 hectares of owned land. Her farm also contains 1 cow, 1 bull and 15 sheep. She sells ecologically-clean milk and wheat to local residents. Her products are in high demand. Serkizhan's monthly business profit is about 5,000 som (KGS), which is not sufficient for a decent life, despite her additional pension income. This is why Serkizhan decided to request a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow. Serkizhan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business, which will help her improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase her income

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to the community. She faces a major challenge of transportation of goods. 

With the loan of 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a widowed mother who has four children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a small fridge to put mineral water and fresh juice in for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a small fridge to put mineral water and fresh juice in for resale

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar was born in 1995. She is a student of the second course at Tajikistan State University Commerce. Nilufar is a very hard-working woman and she studies well. She learns about the economy system and dreams to be a good specialist after graduating university. Nilufar is not married and lives with her parents. 

She is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition. Nilufar awaits your mercy and, in advance, thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Jelie

texts.en:
Jelie is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jelie is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jelie has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rovelie

texts.en:
Rovelie is 41 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Rovelie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of coconut meat to sell.

Rovelie has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future, Rovelie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is a married woman with four children, all whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop for the past four years, selling to consumers at the market place. She faces a major challenge of competition from other competitors in the market.

Tumaini is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to purchase iron sheets to finish her house. She decided to join Yehu to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets to finish her house.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman who has no children. She lives in a rental house  that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a single woman she has no children. Mwanamisi lives in a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food.

Mwanamisi has operated a charcoal selling business for the past one and half years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, wool, craft foam and synthetic cotton for stuffing

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit.

Sofia decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 20,000 loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to replenish her stock.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to replenish her stock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ali would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ali can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ali is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Musa

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:

For over four years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, a sack of charcoal, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, a sack of charcoal, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:

Mariam operates a grocery and vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, coconuts, and cassava for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, coconuts, and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 50 years old and a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Marilyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 33 años de edad tiene dos habilidades importantes, con las cuales ha generado ingresos desde hace 3 años, pues su talento no tiene límites: Por un lado es estilista y se dedica al mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional y por otro confecciona ropa.  Inicialmente peinaba a sus hijas y en este ejercicio aprendió a mejorar sus habilidades. Sus vecinas y particulares conociendo  la calidad de su trabajo y empezaron a convertirse en sus principales clientes, quienes le han ayudado a aumentar sus ingresos. Hoy atiende diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde,  comprando de contado en almacenes especializados donde le ofrecen los mejores precios. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará secadores y una plancha, para incrementar su servicio en la temporada comercial más más dinámica de todo el año, donde por efecto aumentan las ventas y con ellas los ingresos que benefician a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus 4 hijso en las edades de 4 a 12 años.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old and has two important abilities with which she has generated income for the past three years.  First she is a stylist and works improving personal images, and second she makes clothing.  She first began by doing her daughters' hair and in that way learned to improve her abilities.  

Her neighbors and others recognized the quality of her work and began to become her principle customers, and have helped her increase her income.  Today she works daily from 8am to 6pm, buying with cash from specialized stores that offer the best prices.  Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, which she will use to buy hair dyers and a curling iron, in order to increase her services in the holiday season and to provide more dynamism all year around.  This will allow her to increase her income and benefit her family, which is made up of her husband and her four children between the ages of 4 and 12 years old.

loans.use: to buy hair dyers and a curling iron

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en: Hamisu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hamisu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hamisu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Hamisu is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en: Inusa is a maize farmer from Mafera village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Inusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Inusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Inusa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.
